title: Digital Simulation of Dynamic Characteristics of Bypass Throttle Speed Control Hydraulic System
abstract: By establishing a comprehensive mathematical model of the hydraulic bypass throttle speed control system, use the simulink of matlab to emulate equations. Analyze the system parameters such as throttle opening area, oil bulk modulus how to influence the dynamic characteristics of throttle speed control system. Propose measures to improve the system dynamic characteristics. It will provide more accurate scientific basis for the design of hydraulic system and the selection of the main parameters of hydraulic components.

title: Research on safety of polyamidoamine dendrimers mediated foreign gene transfection into pig sperm cells for xenotransplantation [J]
abstract: [Objective] To research on the safety of PAMAM-D (polyamidoamine dendrimers) mediated foreign gene transfection into pig sperm cells for xenotransplantation.[Methods] PAMAM-D/hDAF cDNA compounds were made. Then PAMAM-D and the compounds were incubated with washed pig sperm cells. Next, the effects on sperm motility and deformity were evaluated through Sperm Quality Inspection Workstation in the different groups.[Results] PAMAM-D and the compounds had no obvious impact on sperm motility and deformity through evaluation in Sperm Quality Inspection Workstation.[Conclusion] As a vector, PAMAM-D and PAMAM-D/hDAF cDNA compounds have no cytotoxicity on pig sperm cells. The approach may provide a safe method for the production of transgenic pigs for xenotransplantation.

title: Synthesis of Benzaldehyde Glycol Acetal Catalyzed by Expandable Graphite Modified Under Microwave Irradiation
abstract: Expandable graphite modified under microwave irradiation was prepared and then used as catalyst in the synthesis of benzaldehyde glycol acetal. The influencing factors in the synthesis process were investigated through orthogonal experiment. The optimum conditions were as follows: molar ratio of benzyladehyde to glycol 1Γê╢ 2.5, mass ratio of the catalyst to the total reactants 2.04%, microwave irradiation power 300 W, irradiation time 20.0 min, and the amount of cyclohexane was 6 mL. Under such optimum conditions, the yield of acetal reached 87.6%, and the activity of the catalyst remained basically unchanged after being used for 4 times. The catalyst was studied by SEM and XRD, and the results show that an interlayer compound was instituted by sulfuric acid molecules inserted into the graphiteΓÇ▓ s layers.

title: The Design and Implementation of Leveling Model and Data Analysis System of Eleven Roller Leveler
abstract: For establishing an automatic process control and management system of leveler, we need to combine the software of the automatic process control and the software of real-time data management system. This article introduces something about the Leveling automatic process model, which include softwareΓÇÖs structure, configuration, working principle and achievement. What's more, this system achieved the data management of leveling process and introduced the system configuration, functional structure. The whole system has been applied in multiple leveler and obtained good results, improving the system automation and straightening accuracy.

title: Eating problems and levels of serum minerals in children with autism [J]
abstract: [Objective] To investigate the eating behaviors and levels of serum Zn, Ca, Fe, Mg, Cu of autism children.[Methods] The caregivers of 67 autism children and 52 normal children were requested to complete a questionnaire, especially in the side of selection and acception new food. Atomic absorption spectrometry was used to test levels of serum Zn, Ca, Fe, Mg, Cu contents.[Results] The problems of eating behaviors in autism group were more than in the normal group. The rates of Zn, Fe or Ca deficiency were more serious in autism group than that in normal group.[Conclusions] The problems of eating behaviors and the deficiency of Zn, Fe or Ca among autisms is very serious. Pediatricians should give correct guidance to the caregivers to solve the eating behavior problems.

title: Genetic analysis of polygene markers in porcine genes IGF2, MC4R, JHDM1A and TEF-1.
abstract: Objective: The objective of this study is to detect and analyze the polymorphiams of the candidate genes genes Subject Category: Miscellaneous

title: GC Determination of Benzene Homologues in Water Samples with Solid Phase Micro-extraction [J]
abstract: GC with sample pretreatment by solid phase micro-extraction (SPME) was applied to the determination of 7 benzene homologues, ie, benzene, methylbenzene, ethylbenzene, p-xylene, m-xylene, o-xylene and cumin, in water samples. To attain a higher efficiency for SPME, the 75 ╬╝m CAR/PDMS coating was applied to the micro-extractor, and the extraction was carried out at 20Γäâ for 40 min, with addition of 4 g NaCl to 10 mL of sample solution as salting out agent. The analyte were separated on DB-FFAP capillary column and detected by hydrogen FID. Linear relationships between values of peak area and mass concentration of the 7 benzene homologues were kept in the same range of 1.00-500 ╬╝g┬╖ L-1, with detection limits (3S/N) in the range of 0.12-0.19 ╬╝g┬╖ L-1. The proposed method was applied to the analysis of 4 environmental water samples, giving values of recovery found by standard addition method in the range of 93.3%-104.2%.

title: Wear resistance property of AM60 magnesium alloy modified by plasma surface treatment
abstract: In this work, an attempt has been made to improve the wear and abrasion properties of AM60 magnesium alloy by surface modification using a self-designed plasma generator as thermal source. The influence of surface modification on the microstructure and wear resistance of melting layer was studied by optical microscope (OP), scanning electron microscopy (SEM), energy disperse spectroscopy (EDS) and friction experiment, respectively. The results show that microhardness of the surface-melted samples is obviously higher than untreatment sample. The wear resistance has been enhanced by solid solution strengthening and grain refining strengthening.

title: Laser Cladding of Ni-based Alloy on Mg alloy with Brass Transition
abstract: Laser cladding of Ni-based alloy on Mg-alloy was achieved by using brass as transition layer on substrate. The Ni-based alloy layer free of cracks and porosities was bonded metallurgically with the Mg substrate using brass as the transitional layer. The Ni-based cladding layer was mainly composed of Cr 2 Ni 3, FeNi 3, AlNi 3 while the content of Mg, Al, Cu and Zn is very low in the cladding layer. Microhardness and the wear resistance of the sample were tested, whose results indicated that microhardness and wear resistance increased 12.8 times and 13.3 times, respectively compared with the substrate. In addition, the corrosion potential (E corr) of the sample was much higher than that of untreated materials.

title: The Design of Integrated Camera with VGA Interface [J]
abstract: This paper puts forward a scheme for the development of integrated camera with VGA interface, which uses FPGA to make configuration of the image sensor outputting digital YUV signal to FPGA and using a piece of DDR memory as frame buffer to realize the frame rate increase and the format conversion and therefore making the video signal captured by the image sensor be shown on the VGA monitor in real time, and uses the gray scale differential algorithm, and calculates the high frequency component values of the input luminance information with FPGA, uses the mountain climbing searching strategy to control the optical motor, and realizes the auto-focusing of the image. The system can output highresolution video images and will be used in some occasions having special requirements for image resolution.

title: Therapeutic effect of bronchial lavage and intratracheal injection in treating hypostatic pneumonia
abstract: [Objective] To estimate the effect of bronchial lavage and intratracheal injection in treating hypostatic pneumonia.[Methods] 66 patients of hypostatic pneumonia were randomly separated into two groups. Routine treatment including antimicrobial agents was performed in the control group (n= 30), while the patients in therapeutic group (n= 36) received routine treatment combined with bronchial lavage and intratracheal injection. The therapeutic effect, the hospital discharge rate and the time duration of antibiotic usage were compared and analyzed.[Results] The total effective rate and the hospital discharge rate in therapeutic group were significantly higher than those in control group (P 0.05). The time duration of antibiotic usage in therapeutic group was significantly shorter than that in control group (P 0.05).[Conclusions] Bronchial lavage and intratracheal injection is an effective method in treating hypostatic pneumonia.

title: Isolation and identification of a bacterium strain exhibiting laccase activity and its treatment to papermaking black liquid.
abstract: A novel bacterium strain exhibiting high laccase laccase Subject Category: Chemicals and Chemical Groups

title: Numerical Investigations on the Aerodynamic Performance of Last StageΓÇôExhaust Hood for Steam Turbines
abstract: The aerodynamic performance and internal flow characteristics of the last stage and exhaust hood for steam turbines is numerically investigated using the Reynolds-Averaged Navier-Stokes (RANS) solutions based on the commercial CFD software ANSYS CFX. The full last stage including 66 stator blades and 64 rotor blades coupling with the exhaust hood is selected as the computational domain. The aerodynamic performance of last stage and static pressure recovery coefficient of exhaust hood at five different working conditions is conducted. The interaction between the last stage and exhaust hood is considered in this work. The effects of the non-uniform aerodynamic parameters along the rotor blade span on the static pressure recovery coefficient of the non-symmetric geometry of the exhaust hood are studied. The numerical results show that the efficiency of the last stage has the similar values ranges from 89┬áΓÇª

title: Microstructure and corrosion resistance of AM60 magnesium alloy modified by plasma surface treatment
abstract: Fine single solid solution ╬▒-Mg phases with an average grain size of less than 5 um was obtained in the melting layer of the surface of AM60 Mg alloy by means of plasma beam treatment. The influence of the plasma parameter on both the melting depth and the grain size was discussed. The microstructure, morphology and corrosion properties of the melting layer were analyzed by optical microscopy (OP), scanning electron microscopy (SEM), simulated corrosion test, respectively. The micro-hardness of the melting layer is up to 200 HV 0.05 by means of environment-friendly plasma surface treatment and the corrosion resistance of AM60 magnesium alloy was greatly improved.

title: CORE-SHELL ELECTROSPUN CARBON NANOFIBER/SILICON NANOPARTICLE COMPOSITE FOR LITHIUM ION BATTERY APPLICATION
abstract: Rechargeable lithium ion batteries (LIB), known for its light weight, high energy density, and high voltage capacity per cell, possess a great potential in heavy duty hybrid electric vehicles, aerospace, and military applications [1]. Graphite is used in industry as a standard anode material due to its stable charge/discharge profile and a long plateau at 0.1 V vs. Li metal. However, its maximum theoretical capacity is limited to 372 mAh/g, corresponding to LiC6 structure upon Li intercalation [2-4].Much research has been devoted to increase the energy densities (both Wh/kg and Wh/L) of LIB. Hard carbons are used but the capacity has limited improvement [5]. Various alternative alloying metals have been investigated, among all, silicon is most promising due to its highest theoretical specific capacity of 4200 mAh/g by alloying with 4.4 Li atoms. It also possesses a low charge/discharge plateau at 0ΓÇô0.4 V, which permits high energy output. However, the major challenge for Si-based anode is its 400% volume change during Li ion alloying/de-alloying. This often results in particle fusion, pulverization, and the loss of electrical contact of Si to the current collector [6-8]. Researchers are trying to reduce the amount of volume expansion and contraction by reducing the size of Si to nano-scale [9, 10]. Carbon has demonstrated to be a suitable coating material for Si to prevent nanoparticle agglomeration upon volume expansion and to generate a stable solid electrolyte interface (SEI) for stable capacity [11].

title: Analysis on Reheated Cracks in 12Cr1MoVG Header Fillets of USC Boiler and the Welding Procedure Optimization
abstract: Several cracks were found in 12Cr1MoVG steel header fillets of a 1 000 MW USC boiler during nondestructive examinations before its installation. The residual stress of the fillets has been measured and some tests on the specimens of fillets with cracks have been carried out such as metallography, scanning electron microscope and micro-hardness. The property of reheated cracks in header fillets have been determined by the test results combined with the material, structure and the welding and post heat treatment process of fabrication, installation of the header. The optimized procedure of welding and repair welding have been put forward and the result shows that the reheated cracks in the header fillets have been effectively prevented.

title: Simulated prediction on huge soft base waste dump landslide failure influenced by rainfall [J]
abstract: rock mass strength is decreased due to rainfall. main problem is probed by mine technician to analyzed influence degree for waste dump safety due to rainfall quantity. This paper take a surface waste dump as an example, numerical simulation analysis prediction study on waste dump influence feature are carries out for rainfall quantity, plastic zone is enlarged and sliding face is informed as rainfall is increased. and then deciding basis is provided for safe control and engineering design of waste dump.

title: Analysis and design for the structure of reference spheres mirror in ╬ª150 mm Fizeau interferometer
abstract: In the field of high-accuracy optical testing, in order to ensure the measuring precision, the deformations of the interferometer reference mirror induced by self-weight and the thermal effects must be controlled strictly. A kind of creative mechanical structure of reference spheres mirror is designed for the requirement of high-accuracy Fizeau interferometer. In the support schemes fastened by adhesive, the surface deformations of interferometer reference mirror are computed by means of finite element method. In that case, the peak to valley (PV) value is 9.6 nm and RMS value is 2.1 nm. At the same time, the PV and RMS surface figure error of reference spheres caused by ambient temperature fluctuation is achieved. At last assembly for the reference spheres mirror are investigated.

title: Extraction and separation of alcohol diterpenoids from Jatropha curcas oil
abstract: Alcohol diterpenoids and fatty acids from Jatropha curcas oil were extracted and separated with methanol. After temperature and stirring speed were advised, effect including ratio of methanol to Jatropha curcas oil, stirring time and number of extraction to extraction rate of alcohol diterpenoids were discussed, the effect of cooling temperature and cooling time to separating fatty acid were investigated. The method which the contents of alcohol diterpenoids were determined by UV spectrophotometric was built. The results showed that the optimum conditions as follows: extraction temperature was 30Γäâ, stirring rate1was 120 r/min, stirring time was 20 min, extraction times were 4, liquid-liquid ratio (the ratio of methol to Jatropha curcas oil) followed 2.5, 2.0, 1.5 and 1.0.

title: Screening and Identification of a Lysozyme-producing Streptomyces albus Strain
abstract: A lysozyme-producing strain was obtained from soil using the LB plate and PBS plate both contained Staphylococcus aureus, followed by detecting activity changes after treatment with protease K. Through analysis of physiological properties and the sequence of 16S rDNA, it was finally classified into Streptomyces albus sp. RJ-36 b. Results suggested that its enzyme-producing process was closely relevant to its growth. The maximal activity (108 U/mL) was achieved in shake flask at 32Γäâ, 200 r/min for 60 h.

title: Study on Cutting Propagation Technique for Baphicacanthus cusia [J]
abstract: The effects of different matrix composition, different position, different pitch number and different plant growth regulator on cutting propagation of Baphicacanthus cusia were investigated. The results showed that all of those 4 factors had remarkable effects on rooting occurrence. The best composition of matrix was 2 part river sand plus 1 part perlite, which resulted in 93.5% rooting rate; cuttings from top fragment made high rooting rate, up to 94.2%; the rooting rate of 2 pitch cuttings was 90.7%; and 100mg/L IBA lead to the highest rooting rate, up to 94.5%. Appropriate methods were beneficial to increase the propagation coefficient of Baphicacanthus cusia.[Fund]: σ╣┐Σ╕£τ£üΣ╕¡σî╗Φì»τ«íτÉåσ▒ÇΘí╣τ¢« (2008372);; σ╣┐σ╖₧σ╕éµ₧ùΣ╕ÜτºæµèÇµÄ¿σ╣┐τ½Öτñ║ΦîâµÄ¿σ╣┐Θí╣τ¢« (2009H008);; σìùΦì»Φ╡äµ║ÉΣ┐¥µèñΣ╕Äσê⌐τö¿σ╖Ñτ¿ïµèÇµ£»σ╝ÇσÅæΣ╕¡σ┐âΘí╣τ¢« (GCZX-B0905)

title: Molecular characterizations of two dehydroascorbate reductases from Selaginella moellendorffii
abstract: Plant dehydroascorbate reductase (DHAR) is a physiologically important reducing enzyme in the ascorbate-glutathione recycling reaction. In this study, two DHARs genes (SmDHAR1 and SmDHAR2) were isolated from Selaginella moellendorffii. The SmDHAR1 and SmDHAR2 genes encode two proteins of 218 and 241 amino acid residues, with a calculated molecular mass of 23.97 kDa and 27.33 kDa, respectively. The genomic sequence analysis showed SmDHAR1 and SmDHAR2 contained five and six introns, respectively. Reverse transcription PCR revealed that the SmDHAR1 and SmDHAR2 were constitutive expression genes in S. moellendorffii. The recombinant SmDHAR1 and SmDHAR2 proteins were overexpressed in E. coli, and were purified by Ni-affinity chromatography. The recombinant SmDHAR1 showed 116-fold higher enzymatic activity towards the substrate dehydroascorbate than recombinant SmDHAR2. The recombinant SmDHAR1 showed higher thermal stability than recombinant SmDHAR2. These results indicated obvious functional divergence between the duplicate genes SmDHAR1 and SmDHAR2.

title: Synthesis of TTCP with Improved Solid-state Reaction
abstract: In this experiment, TTCP is synthesised by two different ways, one of which is the improved solid-state reaction, the other liquid-state reaction. The characteristics of the powders were determined by FT-IR and XRD, and the difference of the purity of powders gained by the two methods becomes apparent. The experiment indicates that purer comparatively TTCP can be obtained by both of ways. Moreover, compared with liquid-state reaction, the improved solid-state reaction is fitter for laboratory and factory massive production because of simpler procedure and less time needed.

title: Clinicopathological characteristics and prognosis factors of the triple-negative breast cancer
abstract: Objective To analyze the clinicopathological characteristics and prognostic factors of the patients with triple-negative breast cancer (TNBC). Methods The datas of 111 TNBC patients were retrospectively analyzed. Clinicopathological characteristics, prognostic factors and overall survival were surveyed. Results Of all the breast cancer cases registered in our hospital during this period, 111 TNBC patients accounted for approximately 9.6%. TNBC occurred mostly in young women, with a median age of 46.9 years. The tumor diameterΓëÑ 5 cm was in 24 patients (21.6%). The stage Γàí (59.5%) and stage Γàó (29.7%) were more common. Patients with the axillary lymph node metastasis accounted for 60.4%(67/111), 40 (36.0%) patients presented metastases or recurrence. Univariate analysis suggested that tumor size, lymph node status and TNM stage were prognostic factors of TNBC. Cox multivariate analysis demonstrated tumor size and lymph node status were independent prognostic factor. Conclusion TNBC was a special subtype of breast cancer with a recurrence and poor prognosis.

title: Recent advances in research of surface molecular imprinting technique [J]
abstract: Molecular imprinting technique is a process for preparing functional polymers which are capable of specifically recognizing targeted molecules. Surface molecular imprinting is one of the most active fields in molecular imprinting technique field. In this review, the methods of preparing molecular imprinting polymer including sacrificial template method, in situ membrane polymerization and graft polymerization method, and the recent advances in research of surface molecular imprinting technique were discussed.[Fund]: σ¢╜σ«╢ 973 Φ«íσêÆΦ╡äσè⌐Θí╣τ¢« (2010CB732403);; σ¢╜σ«╢ 863 Φ«íσêÆΦ╡äσè⌐Θí╣τ¢« (2006AA09Z168);; σ¢╜σ«╢µ╡╖µ┤ïσ▒Çτ¼¼Σ╕Çµ╡╖µ┤ïτáöτ⌐╢µëÇσƒ║µ£¼τºæτáöΣ╕ÜσèíΣ╕ôΘí╣Φ╡äσè⌐Θí╣τ¢« (GY02-2011G15);; σ¢╜σ«╢µ╡╖µ┤ïσ▒ÇΘ¥Æσ╣┤µ╡╖µ┤ïτºæσ¡ªσƒ║ΘçæΦ╡äσè⌐Θí╣τ¢« (BJ09-JK1105)

title: Effect of Borax Content on Composition and Microstructure of Boride Layer by Electrodeposition
abstract: Boronizing of silicon steel is performed by electrodeposition in KCl-NaCl-NaF-Na2B4O7∩âù 10H2O molten salts with different amounts of borax. The effect of borax content on composition and microstructure of boride layer is studied. The compositional depth profile of boride layer is measured using the glow discharge spectrometry (GDS) and the depth from the surface to the substrate is taken as the layer thickness. The surface morphology is studied by atomic force microscopy (AFM). It is found that the thickness of the boride layer reached maximum values when the borax content is 0.05 mol. The roughness decreases with raising borax content from 0.01 to 0.05 mol while the further increase of borax content from 0.05 to 0.1 mol results in increase of roughness. The boride layer formed at borax content 0.05 mol shows smallest values of surface roughness.

title: A heterogeneous data exchange approach for RFID-based logistics-customs clearance public service platform
abstract: The heterogeneous data exchange problem of Radio Frequency Identification (RFID) based logistics-customs clearance public service platform is discussed in this paper. By analysing the characteristics of the platform, a heterogeneous data exchange approach is presented, in which a Hybridmatching Algorithm based on Block-Dividing Dynamic Weight (HABDDW) is proposed. The crucial idea of HABDDW is to compare the similarities of the structure and expression between two relation pattern trees. When calculating the similarities, HABDDW not only combines element matching with structure matching, but also integrates linguistic matching with semantic matching. That is, the mapping between any pair of exchanged data is established, and a feasible approach is provided to achieve the goal of information sharing among heterogeneous data.

title: Precision drip irrigation on hot pepper in arid northwest china area
abstract: An experiment was conducted to study the effects of different soil water potential (SWP) on soil water content, hot pepperΓÇÖs yield, water consumption and water use efficiency (WUE) under plastic-mulched drip irrigation in the North-West China in order to find a suitable SWP to guide the pepper irrigation. Five treatments were set based on SWP, they are -10kPa (N1), -20kPa (N2), -30kPa (N3), -40kPa (N4) and -50kPa (N5). A control treatment (N6) was set based on local irrigation practice, i.e. border irrigation. SWP was measured using tensiometers at 0.2 m depth immediately under drip emitters. Pepper leaf area, plant height, soil water content, yield and total soluble solid (TSS) were measured, soil water content and water use efficiency were calculated. Results shows that the differences in leaf area index and plant height are not significant (P>0.05) among treatments of N1, N2, N3 and N4. While the pepper┬áΓÇª

title: The characteristics of biomarkers in pine needles with different growing periods
abstract: The characteristics of biomarkers extracted from needles of the modern living pine with different growing periods were systematically analyzed by gas chromatography-mass spectrometry (GC/MS). Abundant biomarkers were recognized, including n-alkanes, n-ones and saturated fatty acid methyl esters, fatty acid ethyl esters. With the increasing of growing periods, the carbon number distribution ranges of n-alkanes from C 18 to C 37 were found, showing an odd carbon predominance with the maxima at nC 29 in all samples. The average ratio ofΓêæ C 21-/Γêæ C 22+ of n-alkanes is lower (0.013), suggesting that terrestrial high plants are main origins of pine needles and record the typical characteristics of research region (arid and desert region). The ratio ofΓêæ C 21-/Γêæ C 22+, OEP and CPI values of n-alkanes decrease regularly with the increasing of the growing periods record the related climate information; saturated┬áΓÇª

title: Economic evaluation and state time-delayed feedback chaos control of dynamic supply function model in power market
abstract: The dynamic supply function model considering the decision-marking of market participants and transmission constrains of power network in power market is established. The different dynamic behaviors are analyzed, such as Nash equilibrium, period and chaos. With the average profit as the economic evaluation index, the economic performances of dynamic behaviors in the states of Nash equilibrium, period and chaos are analyzed and compared for three-node power market. Among them, the optimal performance appears in the state of Nash equilibrium. In view of the chaotic behaviors in power market, the state time-delayed feedback chaos control method is proposed. Finally, by means of the proposed control method, the chaotic state is controlled to the stable equilibrium point so that the economic performance of dynamic power market is effectively improved.

title: Interface toughness characterization in microelectronic packages based on four point bending test and simulation
abstract: Microelectronic packaging devices consist of various kinds of materials, such as: die, molding compound, adhesives, copper etc. Due to the mismatch of the materials coefficient of thermal expansion (CTE), thermal stress can accumulate in the device, which would cause the interface delamination of microelectronic packaging devices when ambient temperature changes, and eventually lead to the failure of microelectronic packaging devices. In order to predict delamination, interface properties should be obtained. According to the research, temperature has large effects on the interface toughness. Therefore, interface toughness as function of temperature was studied by experiment and simulation in this paper. The results show that the critical crack energy was affected by temperature largely, the higher the temperature is, the smaller the critical crack energy is. The load speed has no effects on the four-point bending┬áΓÇª

title: catena-Poly [[[tetraaquaerbium (III)]-╬╝-oxalato-╬║4O1, O2: O1ΓÇ▓, O2ΓÇ▓][bromidobis (pyrazine-2-carboxylato-╬║2N1, O) cuprate (II)] tetrahydrate]
abstract: In the title heterometallic complex, {[Er(C2O4)(H2O)4][CuBr(C5H3N2O2)2]┬╖4H2O}n, the ErIII atom is eight-coordinated by four O atoms from two centrosymmetric oxalate ligands and four water molecules, displaying a bicapped trigonal-prismatic geometry. The oxalate ligands bridge the Er atoms into a polymeric cationic chain along [110]. The CuII atom is five-coordinated in a square-pyramidal geometry by two pyrazine-2-carboxylate ligands and a Br atom, forming a discrete anion. The polymeric cations, complex anions and uncoordinated water molecules are self-assembled into a three-dimensional supramolecular network through OΓÇöHΓï»N, OΓÇöHΓï»O and OΓÇöHΓï»Br hydrogen bonds.

title: An analysis of reverberation fluctuation by mean square derivation
abstract: A method for evaluating the fluctuation of the reverberation envelope is proposed and examined through simulation and real data in this paper. This method is different from the coefficient of variation which is only a function of the first and second order moment of the reverberation statistical model. By using the standard variance of the mean square derivate (MSD) of the reverberation envelope, the paper shows that the reverberation fluctuation is a function of the bandwidth of the emitted signal, and that a large value of the square variance means little fluctuation of the reverberation envelope. Theoretical studies show that the standard variance is proportional to the bandwidth of the emitted signal, so we conclude that less time width or larger bandwidth of the transmitted signal produces less fluctuation. Simulation and real active sonar data processing are used to verify this conclusion.

title: The pattern recognition receptor-mediated immune tolerance is involved in tumor metastasis
abstract: The interaction of tumor cells with host cells undergoes a progress of immunoediting, including surveillance, equilibrium and escape. The capability of escape from immune-surveillance is a hall marker of tumor cells, which greatly contributes to the tumor growth out of control and the therapy failure in tumor metastasis. It is indicated that tumor cells can recruit amounts of immune cells to tumor site and establish a suppressive immune microenvironment leading to tumor escape. The critical factor for tumor immunotolerance is the establishment of immunosuppressive microenvironment by interaction between pattern recognition receptors with pathogen-associated molecular patterns and damage-associated molecular patterns released from tumor tissue. Therefore, targeting tumor immunotolerance using small molecules or immunostimulatory biological agents such as monoclonal antibody, can inhibit tumor growth and invasion, and subsequently attenuate the tumor metastasis and decrease cancer-caused death.

title: Chi Skin Examination
abstract: Chi skin examination is of displaceable clinical value in the four diagnostic methods of TCM but now barely used in clinical practice. Chi skin diagnosis is considered to consist of cold or heat, moist or dry, hard or crisp skin around, moderate or tight, as well as large or small, slippery or rough pulse through differentiating location, clinical significance of Six Changes in Chi Pulse, and prognosis after combined diagnosis of chi and cun pulses, which requires a comprehensive understanding and combined application in clinic.

title: Study of hepatitis B infection among people entering and exiting the City of Jining.
abstract: We conducted a survey of hepatitis B infection in 16 421 people entering and exiting Jining from January 2008 to June 2009. The results indicated that 377 people were positive for HBsAg at a rate of 2.30%; 350 were hepatitis B virus hepatitis b virus Subject Category: Organism Namessee more details carriers and 27 were patients with hepatitis B. The infection rate for men was significantly higher than for women; the highest infection rate was for individuals 30-39 years of age. By occupational distribution, individuals involved in maritime traffic had the highest infection rate, followed by individuals engaged in business and public servants. Survey results indicated that hepatitis B prevention and control should be enhanced to disseminate knowledge, with a focus on population monitoring and the promotion of hepatitis B vaccination.

title: Analysis on Mortality Data due to Malignant Neoplasms in Shouguang City in 2008 [J]
abstract: [Objective] This study aims to understand the mortality rate of malignant tumors and identify major cancer causes of death in Shouguang, and to provide scientific evidence for public health planning and policy making.[Methods] Deaths due to cancers in Shouguang in 2008 were investigated.[Results] A total of 1 967 deaths were reported with cancers as the underlying cause in 1 023 192 residents in 2008. The mortality rate was 192.24/100 000. Mortality rate (/100 000) for males and females were 239.59 and 143.93, respectively. The rate in 0-, 1-4, and 5-9 age group was 0.00, 12.49 and 1.96, respectively. Mortality was increased with age among people aged 10 years and over. The top four types of cancer as the cause of death for males were lung cancer, liver cancer, stomach cancer, and esophagus cancer; for females were lung cancer, liver cancer, esophagus cancer and breast cancer.[Conclusion] The major cancers as cause of death in Shouguang are lung cancer, liver cancer, stomach cancer, and esophagus cancer.

title: Analysis on Death Data Due to Malignant Neoplasms in Rural Population in Shouguang City from 1993 to 2007 [J]
abstract: [Objective] This study aims to examine the mortality rate of malignant tumors and main cancer causes of death in Shouguang rural population, and to provide scientific evidence for public health planning and policy making.[Methods] Mortality data of Shouguang population in the period from 1993 to 2007 were analyzed.[Results] A total of 4 300 deaths were reported with cancers as the underlying cause during 1993 to 2007. The annual mean mortality rate and its age-adjusted rate were 172.83/100 000 and 126.55/100 000 respectively. The annual cruel rate kept increasing while the adjusted rate a decreasing trend. The cruel rate in males (216.51/100 000) was considerably higher than that in females (127.69/100 000)(P0. 01). The top four types of cancer as the cause of death for both sex and males were lung cancer, liver cancer, stomach cancer, and esophagus cancer; for females were lung cancer, stomach cancer, liver cancer, and esophagus cancer.[Conclusion] The cruel mortality rate due to cancers among Shouguang rural population is rising since 1993. The major cancers as cause of death are lung cancer, liver cancer, stomach cancer, and esophagus cancer.

title: Anatomic study on hook of hamate bone
abstract: OBJECTIVE: To study the hook of hamate bone by anatomy and iconography methods in order to provide information for the clinical treatment of injuries to the hook of hamate bone and the deep branch of ulnar nerve. METHODS: Fifty-two upper limb specimens of adult corpses contributed voluntarily were collected, including 40 antisepticized old specimens and 12 fresh ones. The hook of hamate bone and its adjacent structure were observed. Twenty-four upper limbs selected randomly from specimens of corpses and 24 upper limbs from 12 healthy adults were investigated by computed tomography (CT) three-dimensional reconstruction, and then related data were measured. The measurement results of 24 specimens were analyzed statistically. RESULTS: The hook of hamate bone is an important component of ulnar carpal canal and carpal canal, and the deep branch of ulnar nerve is located closely in the inner front of the hook of hamate bone. The flexor tendons of the forth and the little fingers are in the innermost side, closely lie next to the outside of the hook of hamate bone. The hamate bone located between the capitate bone and the three-cornered bone with wedge-shaped. The medial-, lateral-, and front-sides are all facies articularis. The hook of hamate bone has an approximate shape of a flat plate. The position migrated from the body of the hamate bone, the middle of the hook and the enlargement of the top of the hook were given the names of" the basis of the hook"," the waist of the hook", and" the coronal of the hook", respectively. The short path of the basement are all longer than the short path of the waist. The long path of the top┬áΓÇª

title: Solid-phase Maillard Reaction between L-glutamic Acid and Glucose as Determined by TG-SPME-GC-MS
abstract: In order to explore Maillard reaction without aqueous solution, a novel combinatorial system of thermogravimetrysolid phase microextration-gas chromatography-mass spectrometry (TG-SPME-GC-MS) was designed and a glutamic acidglucose solid phase Maillard reaction pattern was established. Based on sampling in different temperature ranges, the pyrolysis behavior of pure glucose and mixtures of glutamic acid and glucose at different ratios (1: 1, 1: 2, 1: 4, 1: 6, 1: 8, or 1: 10) were investigated and the release tendency of pyrolysis products in different pyrolysis stages was also discussed. The mixture of glutamic acid and glucose exhibited a lower initial pyrolysis temperature (130Γäâ) than that of pure glucose (185Γäâ). At the initial reaction stage (130-170Γäâ) of solid-phase Maillard reaction, the released product was the pyrolysis product of pure glucose. Maillaid products were generated from 170Γäâ, which included 2-pyrrolidone, L-pyroglutamic acid methyl ester, 2-(2oxopyrrolidino) acetamide, and 5-methyl-1H-pyrrole-2-carbaldehyde.

title: Engineering Application of Post-grouting on the Tip and Side for Ultimate Bearing Capacity Improvement of the Foundation Pile [J]
abstract: The construction process of post-grouting on the tip and side for ultimate bearing capacity improvement is presented. 10 piles with post-grouting on tip and side and 2 unpost-grouting piles are tested and analyzed. The results indicated that the length and integrity of piles are satisfactory. The untimate bearing capacity of post-grouting piles are 70% improved at least than that of unpost-grouting piles, making maximum vertical static loading of this time testing piles as ultimate bearing capacity is safer and designing single pile ultimate bearing capacity as 8 800 kN is secure. Post-grouting on the tip and side for ultimate bearing capacity improvement of the foundation pile is feasible but the proper grouting stata choosing. The accurate grounting volume and pressure controlling in the constrution of piles are needed.

title: 1050 HEPATITIS C VIRUS INFECTION AND MORTALITY FROM LIVER RELATED DISEASE

title: Study on Mobile Crustal Deformation Monitoring Technology of Canyon-Reservoir
abstract: The technical project of the mobile crustal deformation monitoring in canyon-reservoir is studied, and its design ideas are put forth, the layout principles of the monitoring network, and the concrete construction scheme, in order to provide a kind of reference for the comprehensively monitoring the earthquake safety project of the canyon-reservoir and the like.

title: Start-up and steady operation of short-cut nitrification in a sequencing batch reactor
abstract: The purpose of this paper is to obtain a start-up of short-cut nitrification systems fed with simulated domestic wastewater at low aeration rates, and to keep the system operation stable. Under the conditions of a temperature of (28┬▒1)Γäâ and a pH value of 8.0, the initial aeration rate and aeration time were controlled to be 80~ 90L/h and 330 min respectively, and the aeration rate was adjusted appropriately in the whole process of reactions. The start-up of our system can be achieved after 39 cycles, and the NO 2--N accumulation and the NH 4+-N removal efficiency reached 94.13% and 92.7% respectively. Thereafter, we discharged the sludge after 81 cycles and gradually increased the NH 4+-N concentration. After 131 cycles, the short-cut nitrification system became stable and exhibited a high capability of NO 2--N accumulation. The results indicate that the start-up can be achieved rapidly by only adjusting the aeration rate, but sacrificing the stability of system. A stable system can be obtained by controlling aeration time, discharging sludge, and increasing NH 4+-N concentration.

title: Research on Scale Energy-saving Fresh Keeping of Sweet Potato under Automatic Temperature and Humidity Control
abstract: To further explore the effective methods for the preservation of sweet potato, the scale energy-saving fresh keeping under automatic temperature and humidity control was designed and set up based on the experiences and practices. Comparing to the preservation effects of current common semi-underground house cellar and underground storage, it showed that new storage had some advantages such as automatic temperature control, humidity control, waterproof, big storage capacity, energy saving and good preservation effects. The goods could be preserved for about 180 days and the preservative rate of potato tubers was more than 95%.

title: Capacitance and Electrostatic Force Distribution Models of Micro Sensors Based on Comb Finger Gaps' MEMS Process Error
abstract: Because the capacitance and electrostatic force are vital to the performance of comb capacitive micro sensors and actuators, based on the comb finger gaps' error brought by the MEMS process, the models of capacitance and electrostatic force probability distribution were proposed after theoretical deduction and ANSYS simulation. It is indicated that, by the model, both the capacitance and electrostatic force distributions are quasi-Gaussian distribution type. Hence the probability for the capacitance and electrostatic force occurring in any interval can be estimated by means of quasi-mean and quasi-variance. The quasi-mean is a little bit different from the value of capacitance or electrostatic force without process error, less than 5%. The quasi-variance depends on the comb finger number and process error degree. When the comb finger number increases from 10 to 60, the quasi-variance of capacitance distribution increases 2 times while is about 1 time for electrostatic force distribution and, as process error degree is from 5% to 20%, the quasi-variance increases 1.5 times for capacitance distribution and is about 2.5 times for electrostatic force distribution. The model is helpful for the further performance exploration based on the process error of quite a large class of comb finger micro sensors and actuators.

title: The Improvement and Research about Experiment Teaching of the Organization Principle of Computer and System Structure
abstract: This text combine some school" whether computer make up principle and system structure" experimental facilities and experiment current situation of teaching at present, design the experiment content meticulously, put forward some feasible experiment teaching and improve the method, by but assuare the computer makes up the teaching quality of the principle experimenting, improve students' thinking ability and manipulative ability conscientiously.

title: On the Treatment of Insomnia
abstract: Clinical findings demonstrate the close relations between insomnia and emotions. Emotional fatigue can cause insomnia while insomnia has backwash effect on one's emotions. This paper explores the treatment of insomnia by combining, firstly the syndrome differentition, secondly, dredging Liver qi and relieving constraint, and thirdly, psychology counselling. The findings manifest a good therapeutic effect of this treatment combination.

title: DIFFERENCE BETWEEN THE FORMATION MECHANISMS OF LITHIUM COMPLEX GREASE AND UREA GREASE [J]
abstract: The effects of the reaction temperature and preparation methods on the dropping point of the lithium complex grease and the urea grease were researched. The difference between the formation mechanisms of lithium complex grease and urea grease was discussed. It was recognized that the association among the molecules of thickener was the key factor that made the lithium complex grease and the urea grease having high dropping point. The thickener molecules in urea grease were simple species so that the grease with high dropping point could be easily prepared, while the thickener used in lithium complex grease was the association of 12-hydroxystearate lithium and dilithium sebacate. If 12-hydroxystearate lithium and dilithium sebacate could not associate each other in the initial stage of grease preparation, the association could not be formed by heating yet. The homogeneous reaction in grease preparation is the main condition for association among molecules of thickener.

title: The research on the leaching characteristics of arsenic and mercury in a raw coal from Northeast of China [J]
abstract: Based on the simulated acid rain leaching experiment of the raw coal and soil from the Northeast of China, the migration characteristic of arsenic and mercury from the coal was introduced.

title: Studies on properties of N-modified brown coal and its application in afforestation in semiarid degraded soil
abstract: In order to find a way in utilizing brown coal with high efficiency, the changes of chemical and biological properties of brown coal after oxidative ammonolysis process (N-modified process) and the application of N-modified brown coal in afforestation in degraded soil were conducted. Results showed that the oxidative ammonolysis process could significantly enhance the cation exchange capacity, increase total humuic acid and fulvic acid contents, and reduce the humin content of brown coal. The total N of N-modified brown coal was 5.8%, existing in different forms (ammonium, amide and closely-combined organic), which can be preserved in soil for a relatively long period. Field application experiment in semiarid area showed that the survival rate of Pinus sylvestris with the addition of N-modified brown coal in soils (137 g or 274 g per tree) were 20%~ 25% more than that in control, by contrast, the urea showed almost no influence on the survival rate. With the improvement of site condition and recovery of the vegetation, the soils with the addition of N-modified brown coal showed significantly increase in soil C sequestration, microbial biomass, dehydrogenase activity, urease activity, ╬▓-glucosidase activity and alkaline phosphatase, indicating the N-modified brown coal can be a kind of ecological and environmental soil amendment.

title: Research on Characteristics of ITO Partnership Risk
abstract: Business will face the huge risk when they form competitive advantages by IT outsourcing. With the development of ITO, more and more organizations treat the ITO as part of business strategies and partnership has become a new trend. After analyzing the existing theories of ITO risk, 14 kinds of possible risks in the ITO partnership were listed according to relationship risk and operation risk. By investigating risks in many industries, such as finance, manufacturing, software, telecommunications, government departments and public utilities with questionnaire, the critical index were refined through principle analysis. After clustering individual samples by principal component analysis, the characteristics of risks in industries were concluded and the possible reasons were analyzed.

title: Effect of Many Elements Synergicdoping on High-temperature Performances of Nickel Hydroxide Electrodes [J]
abstract: New style nickel hydroxide materials were prepared by chemical precipitation of cobalt, zinc, calcium, magnesium, copper, manganese and nickel elements followed by decorating or dopping. Charge-discharge properties were analyzed by galvanostatic charge-discharge cycling technology on conditions of different temperature and different times ratio. Particle size and tap density were also tested. The results showed that particle size distribution ranging from 5 to 8 ╬╝m and tap density is higher. The oxygen evolution potential was enhangced and occurrence of oxygen evolution was inhibited. Simultaneously, co-precipitation based on the synergic effect of many elements was an effective method improving huge current charge-discharge performances at high temperature of nickel hydroxide cathode material.

title: Breeding and Research of Tomato Root-knot Nematode Resistant Rootstocks [J]
abstract: Xianchong jue series 1, 2, 3, 4 that resist to rootstock nematode were chosen by heterosis breeding used tomato material from abroad. Xian chong jue 1, 3 were adopted by Henan province crop seed management station in May 2009, and it identification number was tomato 2009001 and 2009002. Disease resistance ability was identified by pot experiment and seedling inoculation, and grafting affinity, yield and quality were identified by field cultivation experiment. The results showed that xian chong jue series had a good grafting affinity, grafting plants resisted highly to root-knot nematode disease. Yield increased 58.05%, 50.76%, 76.96%, 75.95% compared to CK, it was different significantly, and it not effected tomato quality.

title: A new watermelon cultivar-Haitian 9565.
abstract: Haitian 9565 is a new early-ripening, high-quality, high-yield and steady-yield watermelon cultivar derived from the cross between 92-3 and 92-68. The whole growth period is about 92 days from sowing. The fruit is elliptical with mesh pattern and cyan skin. The skin thickness is 1.0 to 1.2 cm. The flesh is bright red, juicy and crisp, the center soluble solid content is 11.2%. The average mass of a single fruit is 5.5 kg, and the yield is 3 134 to 3 488 kg per 667 m 2. The cultivar has the resistance to diseases and adversity. The fruit surface has good toughness, so it is suitable for storing and transporting. It has been approved by the Provincial Agricultural Crop Cultivars' Assessment Commission as a new early-ripening watermelon which is suitable for commercial cultivation in Henan henan Subject Category: Geographic Entities

title: Data mining for automatic communication behaviors identification
abstract: ChildrenΓÇÖs interpersonal communication, personality, social adaptive capability, and learning ability are affected by the interaction with their caregivers. Therefore, it is important to improve the communication ability of caregiver and it can also improve childrenΓÇÖs language ability and communication behavior. We have to find the communication behavior of child and his/her caregiver from interactive actions and used this information to provide useful information to improve their communication ability. However, the communication behavior should be manually identified and it is a time-consuming process. In this paper, we proposed a data mining algorithm to find the communication behavior. First, child and caregiver have to play three games and the interactive actions are also recorded in video and speech. Those video and speech can help clinical linguists to evaluate the performance of communication┬áΓÇª

title: Isolation and Antibiotic Activities of Endophytes in Gentiana nubigena
abstract: Endophytic strain LD 5 was isolated from the stems of Gentiana nubigena. The fermentation broth of LD 5 showed antibiosis activities against Staphylococcus aureus and Escherichia coli. According to the characteristics of morphology, physiology and biochemistry tests and the comparison of 16 S rDNA sequence, strain LD 5 was identified as Bacillus amyloliquefaciens. Strain LD 5 could produce flavonoids, gentiopicroside, and a kind of analogue of alcoholic extract from Gentiana nubigena.

title: Application and Research for Large-scale Data Platform Build Technology in Earthquake Profession
abstract: Based on industry seismic data processing and storage demands, this paper presents a data model and data platform construction ideas. For seismic data in the industry network construction platform at the national centers, regional centers and stations, a corresponding node of the database platform and data storage platform technology is adopted. The design of a variety of node data backup strategy, implementation of the massive data stream is adopted to satisfy the large-scale high-performance data platform.

title: The Research of Network Congestion Control Based on Multi-Agent
abstract: For network congestion situation, analyze the harm and the reasons for it. To carry out a framework for network congestion control system design based on this Multi-Agent. In a multi-agent function design, carry out a reasonable arrangement, to establishment a framework of network congestion control system for multi-agent system, resolve the problem of congestion and inefficiencies in the operation of local network, ensure the normal operation of the network and improve network efficiency.

title: The flora characteristic of Orchidaceae in Fanjing Mountain Biosphere Reserve, Guizhou, China.
abstract: In this paper, the authors studied the flora characteristic of the orchids in Mt. Fanjing. The results showed: Mt. Fanjing orchids flora is rich. There are 64 species, 1 subspecies and 7 varieties of 38 genera. The number of genera and species account for 50.14% and 29.27% of the total orchid number in Guizhou guizhou Subject Category: Geographic Entitiessee more details orchids respectively. The orchids in Mt. Fanjing are richer than those in neighbouring regions, such as Mt. Jinfo of Southeast Chongqing, Shennongjia region of West Hubei and Xishui of North Guizhou; but less than those in Mt. Emei of Southwest Sichuan and Maolan of South Guizhou;(2) The orchid floristic composition were obviously characterized by a multi-geographic composition including 17 geographic types or subtypes. Moreover, the floristic composition also exhibited the characteristics of the dominance of the Chinese endemic species endemic species Subject Category: Organism Groups

title: Development countermeasures of foaming agent ADC industry in China facing the worldwide financial crisis
abstract: The causes that domestic foaming agent ADC enterprises are running at low operation rate are analyzed. The plans of treating wastewater are proposed. It is pointed out that ADC enterprises should strengthen product import and follow the road of deeply processing products.

title: The analysis of reliability and validity of RTHD for organic mental disorders
abstract: Objective To assess and diagnosis patients with organic mental disorders and patients with comorbidity of mental disorders and physical diseases with Rating Test for Health and Diseases (RTHD-R) and its software RTHD-Logical Verdict System (LVS), and to analysis the reliability and validity of multi-axial diagnosis. Methods A total of 83 patients met with the criteria of CCMD-3 for organic mental disorders (42 patients) and comorbidity of mental disorders and physical diseases (41 patients) enrolled the parallel controlled and multi-center trial. The patients were assessed with RTHD-R and its software-RTHD-LVS in the baseline and the end of a six-month follow-up. Results There were 83 patients in the trial at first, during the follow-up, 1 patient died, 2 patients lost and 80 completed the second rating at the end of follow-up. The results showed that not only there were good reliability between rater A and B, but also validity between raters and clinical diagnosis (golden standard). However there was low validity of clinical diagnosis in Axis Γàí (personality)(╧ç2= 22.89, P0. 001) between the raters and clinical physicians. It was suggested that the Axis Γàí diagnosis often ignored by physicians. The similar results also came from RTHD-LVS. Conclusion The reliability and validity of RTHD testing organic mental disorders are high. It would be also helpful for both clinical work and research.

title: A comparative study of venlafaxine combined with sulpiride for patients with dysthymia
abstract: Objective To explore efficacy and safety of venlafaxine combined with sulpiride for patients with dysthymia. Methods A total of 70 patients with dysthymia were randomly divided into study group with venlafaxine combined with sulpiride and control group with venlafaxine for the treatment of 6 weeks. They were assessed with Hamilton Depression Rating Scale for Depression (HAMD) and Treatment Emergent Symptoms Scale (TESS) at baseline, 1st, 2nd, 4th and 6th weekend after treatment. Results On 1st, 2nd, 4thweekend and 6th weekend after treatment, the scores of HAMD in two groups were all significantly lower than those in baseline. The scores of HAMD in study group had no significant differences compared with control group. The side effects in study group were significantly lower than those in control group. Conclusion Venlafaxine combined with sulpiride are effective to improve the symptoms of patients with dysthymia with lower adverse effects and good compliance.

title: Design and Making of the Sand Table Models
abstract: Sand table, a scaled three-dimensional model, is made of sand and foam sheets according to topographic maps, aero-photograph and real topography to imitate the relief of a local terrain. Sand table provides extensible capacity of development featured in full view, persistence and visualization. This paper attempted to illustrate the procedure of making a sand table in light of author's practice experience, focusing on the schematic design and manufacturing process.

title: Bacterial Diversity in Chilled Chicken by 16 S rDNA-ARDRA and Culture Dependent Approach
abstract: Bacterial diversity of chilled chicken was investigated by culture independent and dependent approach. A total of 45 colonies were recovered from the plate culture of chilled chicken based on morphological characteristics and further identified as 6 genera, including Bacillus sp., Shigella sp., Pseudomonas sp., Citrobacter sp., Klebsiella sp. and Escherichia sp., according to their 16 S rDNA sequences. Direct 16 S rDNA-ARDRA coupled with sequences analysis of DNA extracted from chilled meat showed that the bacteria could be assigned to 16 genera of Acinetobacter sp., Bacillus sp., Acido-vorax sp., Brochothrix thermosphacta, Lactococcus garvieae and Leuconostoc lactis etc. Compared to culture dependent method, culture independent approach disclosed a more diversified bacterial community in chilled chicken, but culture dependent one was still a necessary supplement by showing unique species when┬áΓÇª

title: Distribution of HPV genotypes in the patients with cervical carcinoma and its precursors.
abstract: Objective: To study the distribution of HPV genotypes in the patients with cervical carcinoma and its precursors and the prevalent HPV types. Methods: Type-specific PCR was used to detect HPV genotypes. Results: The positive rate of HPV in the patients with cervical carcinoma was 91.0%, CINΓàá/Γàí/Γàó was 73.3%. The infection rates of the prevalent HPV types were as follows: HPV16, HPV18, HPV58 and HPV33. Conclusion: The prevalent HPV genotypes in the patients with cervical carcinoma and its precursors were as follows: HPV16, HPV18, HPV58 and HPV33. The positive rates of total HPV in different grade of cervical carcinoma and its precursors were different, increasing with the seriousness of cervical neoplasia lesions.

title: Fuzzy mathematical analysis method of high steep slope instability in Buzhaoba mine [J]
abstract: two kinds of analysis method of comprehensive evaluation of fuzzy mathematics and limit equilibrium are used in the light of deformation behavior for high slope in Buzhaoba surface mine. Mechanics parameter adopted RMR method for strength of broken rock mass is achieved. Calculation and analysis used three kinds of limit equilibrium of Sweden, Bishop and Kela are carried out, result is satisfied through comprehensive analysis, thereby, scientific basis for engineering decision is provided.

title: Multiple models adaptive feedforward decoupling controller using HDBD focus
abstract: In a multivariable system, when multiple parameters jump simultaneously, a multiple models adaptive feedforward decoupling controller using hierarchical Dimension-By-Dimension technology is presented to solve the problems such as too many models, long computing time and so on. To find the optimal parameter, it adopts one-dimension search in series instead of multiple-dimension search in parallel. During the one-dimension series search, a hierarchical structure is utilized to reduce the number of the models furthermore. According to the switching index the best model is chosen. At last the global convergence is obtained. In the simulation example, when compared with the conventional multiple models adaptive controller, it reduces the number of the fixed models greatly.

title: Will users embrace advertising in online communities? A sociological perspective
abstract: Drawing on sociology and advertising literature, we investigate the impact of group bonding and group norms on community users' group intentions to embrace advertising in online social communities. By outlining how group intention influence community members' perceptions, this study delineates possible mechanisms by which community members may respond positively to community advertising. An empirical study was conducted with Chinese internet users to test the model. The marketing implication for advertising in online social community follows that community sites in pursuit of advertising revenue should strive to create cohesive bonds and efficient group norms among members.

title: Phylogenetic analysis of symbiotic archaea in the gut of Reticulitermes chinensis Snyder
abstract: OBJECTIVE: To analyze the phylotypes of symbiotic archaea in the gut of Reticulitermes chinensis Snyder by using non-cultivating method. METHODS: We amplified 16S rRNA genes of the symbiotic archaea from the DNA extract of the whole gut with the universal archaeal 16S rDNA primer. A clone library of archaeal 16S rDNA was established and selected clones were sequenced and phylogeneticly analyzed. RESULTS: Five 16S rDNA sequences with the similarity between 93.2% and 99.2% to each other were obtained from Reticulitermes chinensis Snyder. Phylogenetic analysis showed that the five clones were clustered with Methanobrevibacter clones or isolates obtained from Reticulitermes speratus and Reticulitermes flavipes. CONCLUSION: The results showed that symbiotic archaea in the gut of Reticulitermes chinensis were affiliated with Methanobrevibacter.

title: Synthesis of FeΓÇôCo alloy and cobaltΓÇômagnetite composites doped with Nd 3+ by using iron disproportionation
abstract: IronΓÇôcobalt alloy and cobaltΓÇômagnetite composites doped with Nd3+ (Co                   x                 Fe1ΓêÆx                         /Co                   y                 Fe1ΓêÆy                         Nd                   z                 Fe2ΓêÆz                         O4) in which the Fe alloy has either a bcc or a fcc structure and the oxide is a spinel phase, have been synthesized by using the disproportionation of Fe(OH)2 and the reduction of Co(II) by Fe0 in a concentrated KOH solution. Powder X-ray diffraction, scanning electron microscope and vibrating sample magnetometer were employed to characterize the crystallite sizes, structure, morphology and magnetic properties of the composites. And the effect of the Co(II)/Fe(II) ratio (0┬áΓëñ┬áCo/Fe┬áΓëñ┬á1), concentration of KOH, reaction time and substitution Fe3+ ions by Nd3+ ions on structure, magnetic properties of the composites were investigated. From the perspective of thermodynamics, we explain the postulated┬áΓÇª

title: Evaluation of immunization protection efficacy of plague subunit vaccine
abstract: OBJECTIVE: To evaluate the protective efficacy of plague subunit vaccine, BALB/c mice, guinea pigs and rabbits were used in this study. METHODS: Groups of mice (10 per group), guinea pigs (14 per group) and rabbits (6 per group) were immunized with F1+ rV270 vaccine, EV76 vaccine and alum adjuvant by intramuscular route, respectively. Serum antibody titres of mice, guinea pigs and rabbits were determined by ELISA and the immunized animals were challenged with 10 (6) CFU of Y. pestis strain 141 at the 8th week after the primary immunization. RESULTS: The immunized mice, guinea pigs or rabbits with subunit vaccine developed anti-F1 IgG titre of 41 587.3+/-2.1, 11 543.7+/-2.1 or 522.4+/-22.4 and elicited statistical anti-F1 IgG titre difference among them (F= 17.58, P< 0.01). The immunized mice, guinea pigs or rabbits with subunit vaccine had anti-rV270 IgG titre of 15 748.7+/-1.6, 12.6+/-1.4 or 1648.0+/-5.0 and induced statistical anti-rV270 IgG titre difference among them (F value was 16.34, P< 0.01). There was significant anti-F1 IgG titre difference among mice, guinea pigs and rabbits immunized with EV76 vaccine that developed anti-F1 IgG titre of 913.4+/-4.5, 937.0+/-2.0 or 342.0+/-12.0 (F= 23.67, P< 0.01), whereas the immunized mice, guinea pigs and rabbits with EV76 vaccine developed anti-rV270 IgG titre of 12.0+/-1.0, 447.0+/-10.0, 40.0+/-11.0 and there was no anti-rV270 IgG titre difference between them (F= 2.20, P= 0.1314). The immunized mice with subunit vaccine developed significantly higher anti-F1 IgG titres than immunized guinea pigs and rabbits (q value was 30.57 and 19.04, respectively, P< 0.01), and there┬áΓÇª

title: The synthesis and the magnetic properties of Gd3+-doped FexCo1ΓêÆ x/CoyFe3ΓêÆ yO4 micro-octahedrons composites
abstract: Gd3+-substituted micro-octahedron composites (FexCo1ΓêÆx/CoyGdzFe3ΓêÆyΓêÆzO4) in which the FeΓÇôCo alloy has either a bcc or fcc structure and the oxide is a spinel phase were fabricated by the hydrothermal method. The X-ray diffraction (XRD) patterns indicate that the as-synthesized Gd3+-substituted micro-octahedron composites are well crystallized. Scanning electron microscopy (SEM) images show that the final product consists of larger numbers of micro-octahedrons with the size ranging from 1.3 to 5┬á╬╝m, and the size of products are increased with increasing the concentration of KOH. The effect of the Co2+/Fe2+ ratio (0Γ⌐╜Co2+/Fe2+Γ⌐╜1) and substitution Fe3+ ions by Gd3+ ions on structure, magnetic properties of the micro-octahedrons composites were investigated, and a possible growth mechanism is suggested to explain the formation of micro-octahedrons composites. The magnetic properties of the┬áΓÇª

title: Discovering new drug in ancient herbal compound database by unsupervised pattern discovery algorithm
abstract: Combining advanced data mining and biomedical technologies to discovering new drug is an active research field nowadays. In this paper, we collect a herbal compounds for rheum database by searching about 150 prescriptions in ancient herbal document. 255 herbal compounds are included for their combinations to heal rheum. Our aim is to discover potentially new herbal compound in the database. We present the unsupervised pattern discovery algorithm to allocate the herbal compounds into different cluster in a self-organized way and obtain 42 clusters, some of which fully accord with Chinese medicine theory and the other can be considered as the potential new drug, which need to be validated by pharmacology further. We also present an executable and effect strategy for further experiments. We conclude that data mining methods, especially, unsupervised learning method, can be taken as a new┬áΓÇª

title: Analysis on Quality of Rainwater Harvested in Rural Area in Loess Tableland [J]
abstract: The quality of rainwater harvested from courtyard soil ground, brick ground, tiled roof and cement ground in loess tableland and the correlation among main quality indexes are analyzed, and the types of rainwater harvesting sources used for rainwater harvesting were studied. The results show that the rainwater runoff in rainwater harvesting sources is polluted seriously at the early stage, with high pollutants concentration. The concentrations of pollutants are decreased with increasing rainfall duration, and there is a correlation among main quality indexes of rainwater runoff. The quality of rainwater harvested from brick ground, cement ground and tiled roof is better than that of soil ground, so the three kinds of grounds can be used to harvest rainwater. The harvested rainwater can meet the requirements of drinking water treatment when discarding the early stage flush rainwater.[Fund]: σ¢╜σ«╢τºæµèÇµö»µÆæΦ«íσêÆΘí╣τ¢« (2006BAJ08B08-03);; σ¢╜σ«╢µ░┤Σ╜ôµ▒íµƒôµÄºσê╢Σ╕Äµ▓╗τÉåτºæµèÇΘçìσñºΣ╕ôΘí╣ (2008ZX07425-005);; τöÿΦéâτ£üσ╗║Φ«╛σÄàτºæµèÇΦ«íσêÆΘí╣τ¢« (JK2007-21)

title: On Course Integration Teaching of the Conspectus of Mao Ze-dong Thought and the Socialism Theory with Chinese Characteristics
abstract: It is a new topic faced by the teachers of thought politics theory for higher education on how to conduct the integration teaching of a new course The Conspectus of Mao Ze-dong Thought and the Socialism Theory with Chinese Characteristics, and improve the teaching. This paper mainly discusses the prior conditions, basic principles and major means of the integration teaching about this course.

title: 3, 3ΓÇ▓-Bis (4-chlorophenyl)-2, 2ΓÇ▓-(m-phenylenedioxy) diquinazolin-4 (3H)-one
abstract: In the title compound, C34H20Cl2N4O4, the two quinazoline heterocyclic systems and the adjacent chlorobenzene rings are not coplanar, but oriented at dihedral angles of 66.66ΓÇà(13) and 52.48ΓÇà(12)┬░, respectively. The quinazoline ring systems are nearly planar, with dihedral angles between the planes of the two rings of 5.43ΓÇà(16) and 3.40ΓÇà(14)┬░, and are oriented  at dihedral angles of 79.73ΓÇà(13) and 83.52ΓÇà(13)┬░ with respect to the adjacent benzene ring between them. Intermolecular CΓÇöHΓï»O hydrogen bonds contribute to the stability of the structure. In addition, weak ╧ÇΓÇô╧Ç stacking interactions [centroid-to-centroid distances = 3.872ΓÇà(1) and 3.876ΓÇà(1)ΓÇà├à] are observed in the crystal structure.

title: Algorithm Research on Video Compression based on Intra Fast Mode Decision [J]
abstract: With the rapid development of multimedia technology, Higer request for digital Video Compression has been proposed in many fields. the key is that there must be a rapid, efficient compression algorithm. The efficiency has been solved by H. 264 Standard, but it can't be the real-time in the compression speed. In the paper intra-prediction mode selec-tion quick and intra fast mode decision algorithm for H. 264 are researched deeply, and a intra-prediction mode selection quick algorithm based on threshold and predicting direction Correlation among adjacent blocks. the experiment results show, in the algorithm the decreases on peak signal to noise ratio is less than 0.03 dB and rate increases less than 1%, the encode time decudes an average of 22.67%, meanwhile subjective image quality has no obvious change after encoding.

title: Experimental study of optical-thermal effect of skin irradiated by multi-pulse laser
abstract: Temperature distributions of the porcine skin in the radial direction and axial direction were measured by using multi-pulse Nd: YAG laser irradiation under different wavelengths. The results show that the temperature distribution in the skin tissue is significantly affeceted by the measuring position, pulse repetitive freuqency and wavelength, and irradiation energy density. When th wavelength and repectitive frequency are definite, the temperature of the tissue inceases with the energy density, and the photo disruption threshold is 1 118.19 mJ/cm2 at the wavelength of 1 064 nm and the repetitive frequency of 10 Hz; when the wavelength and the energy density are definite, the temperature of the tissue increases with the repetitive frequency; and when the energy density and repetitive frequency are definie, the optical-thermal effect at the wavelength of 1 064 nm is more remarkable than that of 532 nm.

title: A Clinical Study of the Combination Treatment of Sustained-release Nifedipine and Relaxation Therapy in Middle-aged Patients with Hypertension
abstract: Objective To evaluate the effect of sustained-release (SR) nifedipine combined with relaxation therapy on middle-aged patients with hypertension. Methods Ninety middle-aged patients with hypertension were randomly divided into 3 groups. For six months, Group Γàá was with relaxation therapy, Group Γàí was administered with nifedipine SR, and Group Γàó was with both nifedipine SR and relaxation therapy. All patients were assessed with psychotropic symptom checklist (SCL-90) and their blood pressures were monitored. Results Before the treatment, the SCL-90 factors, except for the mentalness factor of the three groups were significantly different from the normal (P0. 01). After treatment, SCL-90 factors of all patients became normal except those of patients in Group Γàí (P0. 05). The blood pressure of all groups decreased to normal level. In particular, the decrease was more significant for Group Γàó than the rest (P0. 05 or P0. 01). Conclusion Sustained-release nifedipine combined with relaxation therapy could improve symptoms of middle-aged patients with hypertension by releasing anxiety and decreasing blood pressure.

title: Study on the specific anti-cancer effects by dendritic cells loaded with bladder-tumor lysate or peptides [J]
abstract: [Objective] To observe specific cytotoxicity induced by dendritic cells loaded with bladder-tumor lysate or acid eluted tumor antigen peptides against bladder cancer cell line.[Methods] BIU-87 cells were frozen and melt repeatedly for 4 times, then tumor lysate were obtained. Otherwise the antigen peptides of BIU-87 cells were obtained by mild acid eluted technique. Healthy volunteer PBMCs cultured with RPMI1640 contained rh GM-CS+ rh IL-4+ rh TNF-╬▒ in vitro for 9 days, and then DCs loaded with bladder-tumor lysate or peptides. Tumor spe-cific CTLs were stimulated by DCs pulsed with bladder-tumor lysate or peptides and cytotoxicity caused by the CTLs against bladder cancer cells was measured by MTT technique.[Results] The tumor antigen content obtained by citric acid-phosptat buffer was (426.0┬▒4.3) ╬╝g, and that by frozen and molten repeatedly was (681.0┬▒5.6) ╬╝g. DCs can be harvestd through healthy volunteer PBMCs cultured in vitro. Through lactate dehydrogenase release technique, CTLs activated by both DCs can kill BIU-87 cells significantly while cytotoxicity induced by dendrtic cells pulsed with tumor antigens obtained by citric acid-phosptat buffer was stronger, which had a statistic signifi-cance (P 0.05).[Conclusions] Bladder cancer cells were eluted by citric acid-phosptat buffer or frozen and molten repeatedly, then tumor antigens were obtained. DCs loaded bladder tumor antigens can produce remarkably specific CTLs, which can kill tumor cells specifically. And this cytotoxicity induced by citric acid-phosptat buffer was stronger. So we provide definite experiment basis for the clinical application of vaccine based on DCs.

title: Identification recognition based on high resolution retinal capillary vessel image of human eye
abstract: Retina recognition has the advantages of high stability and security. Because low resolution retina image obtained by traditional fundus camera is difficult to be coded and matched, retina identification recognition is not widely applied. High resolution capillary vessel image is acquired by adaptive optics high resolution retina imaging technique, and the texture of image is extracted by Gabor filters after being normalized and denoised. The character matching is completed by Hamming distance. Experimental results show that the proposed method can accurately identify different samples and is feasible. Retina capillary vessel identification recognition extends the application of adaptive optics high resolution retina imaging technique and has a potential application in some important situation.

title: Development and application of cationic surfactant emulsified wax for use in aqueous drilling fluid
abstract: A cationic surfactant emulsified wax, WPS, as multifunctional drilling fluid additive was prepared by a D phase emulsification process. The manufacturing procedure was presented. For this chemical, the fluorescence intensity wasΓëñ 0.5 and the electrokinetic potential on dispersed droplet surfaces was+ 50mV at pHΓëñ 10. Its inhibitory capability was high as shown by shale cuttings recovery of 85.3% and 22.7% after being rolled at 150Γäâ in 16 hrs in 2% WPS and 10% KCl solutions, respectively. 2% WPS treated 4% fresh water bentonite mud was tolerant to contamination by 6% WPS. The lubricating capacity of 2% WPS in a polymer/sulfonate salt water fluid, commonly used in Zhongyuan oil fields, was better than that of 2% black MMH product. The core permeability recovery determined in a core damage test with a well site fluid treated by 1% and 2% WPS raised from 84.09% to 87.03% and 90.70%, respectively. 3 WPS polymer saturated salt water fluids, converted from a well site fluid, and their rheologic and filtration characteristics were presented in tables. This WPS driling fluid system was sucessfully used in drilling several tens wells in Zhongyuan, including wells of bottom temperature as high as 150Γäâ and following results were noticeable: borehole enlargement of 12.4% in a test well; core permeability recovery in average of 87.7% and 82.5% in static and dynamicc test, respectively; average daily oil output significantly increased as compared with the wells drilled with polymer/sulfonate fluids.

title: Research of the sensibility of microbial population in axillary fossa and the distribution of apocrine sweat gland [J]
abstract: Objective To discuss the sensibility of common microbial population in axillary fossa. and the distribution of apocrine sweat gland, in order to provid dependable evidence for optimizing a scheme of osmidrosis operation and decrease postoperative adverse reaction. Methods To take the metabolin in axillary fossa for bacterial culture and susceptibility test when preoperation, Under local swelling anesthetize, we used the cut of axillary furrow to resect apocrine sweat gland and treated 102 cases of osmidrosis. we took part cases' skin at 0.5 cm outside and centrally axillary hairs for pathology. Results After 6~ 12 months' follow-up, postoperative results demonstrated satisfactory effect. the rate of excellence was 97.5%. Conclusion On the basis of distribution of apocrine sweat gland, reasonable depth of incision and extent of segregation, using sensitive drugs to prevent infection and appropriate postoperative care are the keys to guarantee the success and decrease adverse reaction of operation to treat osmidrosis.

title: Effects of Strain Rate and Temperature on Compressive Deformation Behavior of TA15 Furnace Cooling State Titanium Alloy during ╬▒+ ╬▓ Two-phase Region [J]
abstract: The high temperature compression tests of furnace cooling state TA15 titanium alloy were carried on Thermecmastor-Z simulator in the temperature range of 750-950Γäâ and strain rate range of 0.001-10 s-1. The influences of strain rate and temperature on the flow stress and microstructure of the alloy were studied. The results show with the increase of temperature and decrease of strain rate, the flow stress of the alloy decreased, the ╬▒-phase content also decreased, deferences between the ╬▒-phase in grain and along the boundary disappeared, and part ╬▒-phase occured nodularization. The optimum forging parameters for TA15 titanium alloy were in the temperature range of 850-950Γäâ and strain rate range of 0.001-0.01 s-1.[Fund]: µ▒ƒΦÑ┐τ£üΦç¬τä╢τºæσ¡ªσƒ║ΘçæΦ╡äσè⌐Θí╣τ¢« (2007GQC1575);; µ▒ƒΦÑ┐τ£üµ¥ÉµûÖτºæσ¡ªΣ╕Äσ╖Ñτ¿ïτáöτ⌐╢Σ╕¡σ┐âΘóäτáöσƒ║ΘçæΦ╡äσè⌐Θí╣τ¢« (ZX200601002);; σìùµÿîΦê¬τ⌐║σñºσ¡ªσñºσ¡ªτöƒτºæµèÇσê¢µû░σƒ║ΘçæΦ╡äσè⌐Θí╣τ¢« (106004220054)

title: Research on Dynamic Mechanism of Hi-tech Industry Cluster [J]
abstract: The paper reviews briefly the progress of the research on the dynamic mechanism of a hi-tech industry cluster. Then it discusses the evolution process of and stage division of the development of a hi-tech industry cluster, with the emphasis on analyzing the difference of growth dynamics in various stages and revealing the development mechanism. Further more, it studies the evolution approach of a hi-tech industry cluster based on specific networks.
