At last it builds a model of dynamic mechanism of the development of a hi-tech industry cluster determined by formation dynamic, location directing force, agglomeration power and innovation ability.

title: Effects of starter feeding time on yolk sac absorption of new hatched goslings
abstract: An experiment was conducted to investigate the effects of starter feeding time on yolk sac absorption of newly hatched Yangzhou gosling. A total of 480 Yangzhou geese with an similar average weight of 92.3 g were selected and randomly assigned to four groups according to four feeding schedules (fasting for 12, 24, 36 and 48 h posthatch), designated respectively as group T12, T24, T36 and T48. Each group of 120 birds comprised of four replicate subgroups with 30 geese per group comprising of 15 males and 15 females. After fasting, all birds were provided with feedstuff ad libitum until 156 h of age. At 12, 36, 60, 108, and 156h posthatch, two geese (1 male and 1 female) per replicate of each experimental group were randomly selected and individually weighed. The yolk sac of each gosling was then taken out and the content of water, crude protein and crude fat in the yolk sac was determined. Results showed that the initial food deprivation reduced body weight (BW) of experimental geese, with less BW realized as the fasting period was prolonged. BW of the group T12 was significantly higher than that of the group T48 (fasted for 48h) at 36 h of weighing posthatch P< 0.05. BW of group T24 was more than that of T48 from 60 to 156 h of age (P< 0.05). The yolk sac weight of group T48 was more than the other three groups at all the designated times, though the difference was not significant (P> 0.05). At the same time, the content of crude protein and crude fat in yolk sac of group T48 was the highest, however the content of water was the lowest. Results of the present study demonstrated that the maximum fasting period with no significantly┬áΓÇª

title: Si Ni Powder prescription on the treatment of diabetes with liver stagnation: A clinical study of 30 cases
abstract: Objective: This paper is to explore the clinical effect of Si Ni Powder prescription on the treatment of patients with diabetes and liver stagnation. Methods: 60 patients of diabetes with liver stagnation were ramdonly divided into the treatment group (30 cases) and the control group (30 cases). Both groups were given Diamicron with diet control and proper exercises. The treatment group were given the Si Ni Powder description while the control group the guweisu. The therapeutic effects were evaluated after one month on the symptom of liver stagnation, FBG, P2hBG and Fins. Results: The Si Ni powder prescription produced positive effects on the treatment group with FBG and P2hBG decreasing and insulin sensitivity superior to the control group (P0. 01). Conclusion: Si Ni Powder description controls symptom and helps reduce blood glucose. The working mechanism is probably related with the regulation of Qi and blood, the adjustment of autonomic nerves and the reduction of insulin resistence.

title: Survey Analysis of Library Readers in Private Medical College
abstract: Survey on readers is an important way to get the demand of library readers. In this paper, through questionnaire survey in Vocational Colleges, show the current situation of the readers, readers habits, etc. According to readersΓÇÖ current situation and the evaluation of library, it will provide proposals on optimizing structure, improving the quality of services and will find a suitable direction of Vocational College Library.

title: Study on Ground Stress Field of Kelameili Gasfield [J]
abstract: Kelameili Gasfield is a key natural gas exploration play in Junggar Basin and also an important productivity construction block of Xinjiang Oilfield. Study on ground stress field will provide guidance and reference for solving the geological and engineering difficulties such as the development planning, the development well pattern arrangement, the reservoir reconstruction and the borehole stability analysis in the area. The logging data of key wells were selected, and the ground stress orientation was determined by drilling-induced fractures inference and caliper logging methods. Ground stress was computed by the ground stress model developed by Stanford University (US) and the chart interpretation method. The computed value, with higher precision and better continuity, accords with the measured value very well.

title: Numerical Calculation of Heat Transfer Distribution in a 600Mwe Supercritical Circulating Fluidized Bed Boiler
abstract: The water wall heat transfer and heat flux distribution in a 600MWe supercritical CFB boiler with water-cooled panel in the furnace was numerically studied. The water wall was made of smooth tube membrane. The solid suspension density ╧ü, heat flux q and heat transfer coefficient K distribution in the furnace were predicted at rated boiler load (100%BMCR), 75% of turbine heat acceptance load (75% THA) and 50% THA. The results show that for a large-scale CFB boiler, the convection is the main part of heat transfer in the lower furnace, and radiation is the main in the upper lower. The ╧ü, q and K have the similar axial and radial distributions. Their radial distributions depend on the position of the water wall and boiler load, and show a peak value in the corner. The ╧ü is a sensitive to K. With increasing of the height in furnace, ╧ü decreases, thereby the q and K decrease. The radial distributions of q and K are┬áΓÇª

title: Threshold co-integration analysis of the relationship between crude oil and gold futures prices
abstract: This paper employs the momentum threshold error-correction model, and investigates the asymmetric causal relationships between each pair of two oil benchmark (ie, West Texas Intermediate, Brent) and gold prices in the futures market. The sample covers the daily period May 1, 1994ΓÇôNovember 20, 2008. The results reveal long-run equilibrium relationships exist between the prices of crude oils and gold. More importantly, the results from Granger-Causality tests based on corresponding momentum threshold error-correction model (M-TECM) clearly point out there is asymmetry in the adjustment process and causality relationship between these two commodities. The adjustment process and the causality relationship are specifically modeled and implications are discussed in this paper.

title: Application and effect assessment of comfort care model in laryngeal neoplasms patients after total laryngectomy
abstract: Objective: To explore the application and effect assessment of comfort care model in laryngeal neoplasms patients after total laryngectomy. Methods: Totally 110 laryngeal neoplasms patients experienced total laryngectomy were provided comfort care in our hospital from March 2006 to December 2007. Results: The application of comfort care in laryngeal neoplasms patients after total laryngectomy could effectively alleviate patients' anxiety, increase their comfort level and satisfaction with nursing, and reduce the incidence ratio of surgical complications, thereby contribute to their quick recovery. Conclusion: Comfort care is an effective way of nursing. The application of comfort care in laryngeal neoplasms patients after total laryngectomy could improve the patients' survival and life quality and meet the needs of patient's requirements of comfort in physical and psychological aspects, so the quality of care is improved.

title: Reburning characteristics of residual carbon in fly ash from CFB boilers
abstract: The content of residual carbon in fly ash of CFB boilers is a litter high especially when low-grade coal, such as lean coal, anthracite coal, gangue, etc. is in service, which greatly influences the efficiency of boilers and fly ash further disposal. Reburn of fly ash through collection, recirculation in CFB furnace or external combustor is a possibly effective strategy to decrease the carbon content, mainly depending on the residual carbon reactivity. In this work, the combustion properties of residual carbon in fly ash and corresponding original coal from large commercial CFB boilers (Kaifeng (440t/h), and Fenyi (410t/h), all in china) are comparably investigated through experiments. The residual carbon involved was firstly extracted and enriched from fly ash by means of floating elutriation to mitigate the influence of ash and minerals on the combustion behavior of residual carbon. Then, the combustion characteristic of┬áΓÇª

title: Study on the Behaviors of Young Giraffe Naturally Nursed
abstract: The behaviors of two young giraffe born in 2005 and 2008 at the Chengdu zoo were recorded during one month after they born. These young giraffes were nursed by their mothers. Results showed the main behaviors of young giraffes included lying, walking, standing, sucking milk, and running. The percent ratio of lying and standing behaviors were 61.7% and 32.3%, respectively. The results also showed the young giraffe began to ingest grass at 10 days old and they could ingest more grass at 4 weeks old.

title: A multi-center survey on informed consent and confidentiality among Chinese counselors and psychotherapists
abstract: The study used self-made questionnaire of the ethical problems in psychotherapy and counseling to explore the ethical behaviors among one thousand Chinese counselors and psychotherapists. The results showed that the ethical belief of informed consent and confidentiality were deficient in the Chinese counselors and psychotherapists. The ethical beliefs of some participants to some items were blurring. To intensify the professional education, to unify the ethical code can improve the current states of counselors and psychotherapists.

title: Kinetics of reaction between Pu (IV) and (hydroxyamino) acetic acid in nitric acid solution
abstract: [en] In order to understand the (hydroxyamino) acetic acid (HAAA) of reduction performance to Pu (IV), the kinetics of reaction between Pu (IV) and HAAA in nitrous acid solution was determined by spectrophotometrically method. The rate equation is-dc (Pu (IV))/dt= kc (Pu (IV)) c 1.50 (HAAA) c-1.00 (H+) c-0.63 (NO 3-), where reaction rate constant k=(42.1┬▒4.2)(mol/L)-0.13┬╖ s-1 at 15.8 degree C. The activation energy E a is (78.0┬▒1.6) kJ/mol. Effects of c (HAAA), c (H+), c (Fe 3+), c (UO 2 2+), ionic strength and temperature on reduction rate of Pu (IV) were investigated. Pu (IV) can be reduced to Pu (III) rapidly by HAAA under usual conditions. The reaction rate can be accelerated by increasing concentration of HAAA, decreasing HNO 3 concentration and ionic strength as well as rising temperature. The influence of UO 2 2+ on reaction rate is negligible. The application of HAAA in the separation between Pu and U is promising.(authors)

title: Influence on Pregnancy Outcome of the Risk Factors of Premature Rupture of Membranes [J]
abstract: Objective: To investigate the etiology of premature rupture of membranes and the influence on pregnancy outcome. Methods: Two hundred and eighty-three pregnant women with premature rupture of membranes who had delivered in hospital in the First Clinical Hospital of Shanxi Medical University from January 2007 to December 2008 were assigned to be a premature rupture of membranes group and 2265 pregnant women who had delivered in hospital contemporaneously were assigned to be a control group so as to be analyzed retrospectively. Results: The incidence of pregnant women with complicated infection before pregnancy or during pregnancy, the intrauterine surgical history, twins, cephalopelvic disproportion, abnormal fetal position, cervical internal relaxation and malnutrition in 283 cases of premature rupture of membranes was higher than that of the control group and the difference had statistical significance (P0. 05). The incidence of pregnant women with cesarean section, postpartum hemorrhage, puerperal infection, fetal distress, premature birth, neonatal asphyxia and pneumonia was higher than that of the control group and the difference had statistical significance (P0. 05). Conclusion: Premature rupture of membranes may be caused by many reasons and it has extremely harmful to the mother and infant. It is important to enhance pre-pregnancy education, regular inspection during pregnancy, active treatment, prevention of reproductive tract infections and assurance of adequate nutrient intake so as to reduce the incidence of premature rupture of membranes and improve the safety of the mother and infant.

title: Analyses of millimeter-wave reflector antennas using a novel fast method
abstract: A novel approach to computing millimeter-wave reflectors is proposed. In this approach, the computational model is created by means of the axisymmetry property and the MoM based on the bodies of revolution is used to analyze this model. To reduce the number of unknown quantities, the hybrid base functions are used, ie, the entire-domain base functions are applied in the main reflector with a flat geometry, and sub-domain base functions in the complex feed source region. Computational results are compared with those obtained by the full-wave MOM and experiment. It is shown that the numerical results are in good agreement with the results obtained by the full-wave MOM and the measured data, and supports a new way to design high-performance microwave transmission antennas.

title: Electro-optic properties of DR1 doped SiO 2 organic/inorganic guestΓÇôhost films
abstract: We made a comprehensive investigation on the electro-optic (EO) properties of hybrid sol-gel silica film doped with Dispersed Red 1 dye (DR1/SiO2). An important finding is that the dipoles which donΓÇÖt orient along the direction of corona poling field in the films can be instantaneously poled by alternate modulation electrical field. This instant poling effect results in the EO coefficients dependent on the frequency and intensity of alternate modulation electric field, and some experiments have proved it. We also investigated the electro-optic coefficients and thickness of films at different stir temperatures (Ts) of start solution and at different number densities of DR1. Experimentally the DR1 number density was optimized to an order of 1021/cm3 and a large EO coefficient of ╬│33= 37 pm/V for DR1/SiO2 film was measured by simple reflection technique at 1 kHz frequencies of modulation electric field. These findings may benefit the practical application of DR1/SiO2 films in the field of EO modulator and EO probing.

title: A study of geographic problem solving environment in cooperative distributed design
abstract: To adapt well to modern distributed and heterogeneous network environment, geographic information systems (GIS) should be able to create, manage and optimize spatial analyses. Building up spatial analyses using pre-existing spatial data and geographic models, which are from different regions and belong to different institutes, can lead to higher efficiency in solving complex geographic problems. Cooperative distributed geographic problem solving environment (CDGPSE) offers an interactive, efficient, and feasible environment through which geographically separated geographers can conduct collaborative work. In this paper, resources layer, service layer, integration layer and application layer are tightly coupled to develop a CDGPSE system. Using Web Services-based architecture is efficient to integrate and share distributed resources as well as modelling procedures built on different platforms. Finally, a┬áΓÇª

title: Press-fit power connector
abstract: A press-fit power connector includes a female terminal base, a plurality of female power terminals and a plurality of female signal terminals. The female power terminals and the female signal terminals are mounted on the female terminal base. Each female power terminal has a terminal contacting portion, a fixing portion, and a pin portion. The terminal contacting portion has an end hole and a clamp slot on one end, and the end hole connects with the clamp slot. The fixing portion is formed by extending the other end of the terminal contacting portion and has at least one borehole. The pin portion is formed by bending and extending one end of the fixing portion which is far away from the terminal contacting portion and has an eye of needle. Based on the above structure, the present invention can improve the yield of products and reduces manufacturing costs.

title: Study on effect of sho-saiko-to compound on growth of nasopharyngeal carcinoma cells in CNE-bearing nude mice
abstract: OBJECTIVE: To investigate the role of sho-saiko-to compound (SSTC) on the growth of the well-differentiated squamous cell line 1 of nasopharyngeal carcinoma (CNE-1) and well-differentiated CNE-2 in tumor-bearing nude mouse, and try to supply scientific data for its clinical development. METHOD: SSTC were prepared by concentration gradients, and the effect of SSTC on the growth and proliferation of the CNE-1 and CNE-2 were investigated by MT assay and soft-agar colony formation test. After setting up the subcutaneous tumor-bearing nude mouse model at the right lower back (0.2 mL CNE-2 cell suspension, 5 x 10 (5)/mL), we randomly divided forty mice into 5 groups and gave high, middle and low concentration groups of SSTC (0.5, 0.25, 0.125 g X mL (-1) by intragastric administration. Positive and negative groups were set up for comparison. After constant administration for 15 days, the volume and weight of the tumor were measured for inhibition rate, so as to investigate the role of SSTC on the CNE-2 bearing tumor. RESULT: In vitro, compared with negative control, SSTC at different gradient concentrations were cultured with the CNE-1 and CNE-2 for 24 h, 48 h and 72 h. It showed that the growth and proliferation of both cell lines were inhibited to some extent. The inhibition rate was increased as the concentration and culture time increasing. Both MTT assay and soft-agar colony formation test showed that the 50% inhibiting concentration (IC50) was about 2.5 g XL (-1). In vivo, compared with negative control, the SSTC could slow down the tumor growth in the SSTC treated groups. The tumor growth of the negative control group (0┬áΓÇª

title: Regression of abdominal aortic aneurysms by targeting Toll-like receptor 2
abstract: Abdominal aortic aneurysm (AAA), a chronic inflammatory disorder, results in progressive expansion and rupture of the aorta with high mortality among elderly people. There is increasing evidence that both innate and adaptive immunity tightly regulate the progress of AAA. We recently find that TLR2 plays a critical role in the regulation of wound-repairing process after tissue injury caused by the molecules of pathogen-associated molecular pattern or damage-associated molecular pattern. We wondered if TLR2 had a role in mediating calcium-induced inflammatory responses to participate in the development of AAA in a mice model of CaCl2-induced AAA. We found that selectively blocking TLR2 activity using a TLR2-neutralizing antibody not only prevented the development of AAA but also caused regression of well established AAA elicited by incubation of calcium. Furthermore, TLR2 deficient mice failed to┬áΓÇª

title: Syntheses and properties of the FeΓÇôCo/Fe3O4 ferrites
abstract: The Fe alloyΓÇôferrite composites FeΓÇôCo/Fe3O4 are synthesized by using disproportion of Fe (II) and reduction of Co (II) by Fe0 in a concentrated and boiling KOH solution. The Fe alloy and ferrites are prepared in aqueous solution without any templet and surfactants at low temperature. Their structures and magnetic properties are investigated by X-ray diffractometer (XRD) and vibrating sample magnetometer (VSM). From the results of XRD, it is shown that the samples have b.c.c and f.c.c structure of Fe, and the spinel structures of the ferrite before calcinations; the samples have b.c.c and spinel structures after calcinations at 300┬á┬░C; and the samples have only f.c.c structure and the spinel structures calcined at 500┬á┬░C.

title: On Existence and Uniqueness Results for Nonsmooth Implicit Differential Equations
abstract: The classical implicit function theorem gives conditions that the function is Fr├⌐chet differentiable and the derivative is surjective. In this short article they are generalized to conditions of Lipschitz and monotone type. The newly obtained implicit function theorems are used to derive two sets of sufficient conditions for the existence and uniqueness of solutions to the initial value problems of nonsmooth implicit differential equations.

title: Confidential performance feedback and organizational capacity building to improve hospital patient safety: results of a randomized trial
abstract: Objective: The objective of this study was to evaluate the effect of two intervention strategies, performance feedback reporting and organizational capacity building, both of which aim to improve patient safety in hospitals but for which there is a paucity of empirical data on effectiveness. Methods: We randomly assigned the 127 non-Federal, acute care hospitals in Wisconsin to one of three groups:(1) performance feedback reporting,(2) performance feedback reporting and organizational capacity building, and (3) control (no interventions). Reported medical injury rates were based on the Wisconsin Medical Injury Prevention Program (WMIPP) surveillance criteria. We compared adjusted pre-and postintervention injury rates overall, in four broad categories, and for five priority areas targeted in the organizational capacity building. Results: The groups of hospitals were similar with respect to location, structure, inpatient┬áΓÇª

title: Synthesis and mesomorphic properties of fluorinated Schiff's base esters containing alkyl and alkoxy end groups
abstract: Two series of fluorinated Schiff's base esters have been synthesized and characterized. Their chemical structures were identified by FTIR, 1H NMR, and elemental analysis (EA). Their mesomorphic properties were studied by polarizing optical, microscopy (POM) and differential scanning calorimeter (DSC). It was found that most of the compounds with alkyl end group exhibited enantiotropic smectic A and nematic phase; while that with alkoxyl behaved differently, some exhibited enantiotropic smectic A and nematic phase; others exhibited monotropic smectic A and enantiotropic nematic phase or unique enantiotropic nematic phase. And for both series, their melting point and clearing point temperature decreased and thermal ranges of mesophase increased with the length of their end groups (n). Furthermore, it was also found that the increase of n was propitious to the stability of smectic phase but went against for┬áΓÇª

title: Business Intelligence Recovery from Legacy Code
abstract: The paper introduces a concept, BI (business intelligence) recovery, in software reverse engineering research. It is named to alternate "business asset", because we discover the abstract knowledge along with reverse engineering result could generate new wisdom. And this new wisdom could be taken into account in program understanding. The main difficulty in extracting program structure from program code is we are lacking the knowledge of business intelligence, which is complementary to program code. Here, we propose our research method and solution to solve this issue.

title: Akt activation mediates estrogen-induced neuroprotection against beta amyloid
abstract: OBJECTIVE: To investigate the effects of estrogen 17beta-estradiol on beta-amyloid protein 25-35 (Abeta25-35)-induced neurotoxicity and possible mechanism thereof. METHODS: Primary cortical neurons were obtained from the brain of a SD rat and cultured and treated with Abeta25-35 and 17beta-estradiol. I order to investigate the possible mechanism of antagonism of estrogen against the neurotoxicity of Abeta25-35, Akt-I, a specific Akt inhibitor and ICI-182780, an inhibitor of estrogen receptor were added before the addition of estrogen. The Abeta32-35 induced cell viability and lactate dehydrogenase (LDH) release into the cell media was detected with spectrophotometer. Western blotting was used to detect the level of phosphorylated Akt, a cell-protecting factor, and level of nonphosphorylated Akt in different conditions. RESULTS: 20 micromol/L Abeta25-35 decreased the cell viability of the rat cortical neurons to 40.4%(P< 0.01) as compared with the control group and the cell viability of the group with the addition of 17beta-estradiol was 84.2%, significantly higher than that of the Abeta25-35 group (P< 0.01). The LDH secretion level of the Abeta25-35 was 172.5% as high as that of the control group (P< 0.01), while that of the 17beta-estradiol preincubation group was only 118.5% that of the control group (P< 0.01). Both Akt inhibitor and estrogen receptor antagonist partially antagonized estrogen's protective effects against Abeta25-35 in cell viability. Abeta25-35 decreased the phosphorylated Akt level to 69.5%(P< 0.01), while estrogen 17beta-estradiol pretreatment antagonized this effect to 94.7%(P< 0.01), and the addition of Akt inhibitor┬áΓÇª

title: Effects of artificial Ulmus pumila forest on plant diversity of temperate grassland in Inner Mongolia
abstract: Based on field survey, the effects of artificial Ulmus pumila forest on the species diversity of temperate grassland in Siziwang Banner of Inner Mongolia were studied. The results showed that U. pumila forest had obvious effects on the species diversity of grassland. With increasing density of U. pumila, the Patrick's richness, Pielou's evenness and Shannon-Wiener index of grass species under the forest had a decreasing trend, and were higher nearby the forest than far from the forest. The habitat inside the forest was favorable to Silene jenisseensis, while that nearby the forest was favorable to Heteropappus altaicus, Pocockia ruthenia, Potentilla bifurca, Leymus secalinus and Cleistogenes squarrosa, suggesting that to blindly exclude forestation on grassland could be less scientific, while properly afforesting U. pumila on the sides with relatively abundant soil moisture should be available to the conservation of plant diversity in temperate grassland regions.

title: Design and fabrication of high numerical aperture and low aberration Bi-convex micro lens array
abstract: Micro lens array is crucial in various kinds of optical and electronic applications. A micro lens array with high numerical aperture (NA) and low aberration is in particular needed. This research is aimed to design and fabricate such a micro lens array with simple structure while keeps the same NA of a same-diameter hemisphere lens. A bi-convex semispherical micro lens array, with corresponding NA 0.379, by PDMS is first designed and analyzed. Experiments are further conducted to fabricate the designed micro lens array by the thermal reflow process. The formed profile is then sputtered with copper to serve as the mold. The front and the rear micro lens array are fabricated by plating PDMS to the mold and then assembled to form the designed micro lens array.

title: Expression and function of toll-like receptors in B lymphocytes
abstract: Toll-like receptors (TLRs) are widely expressed in the innate and adaptive immune system. They initiate host defense against endogenous and exogenous pathogens containing conserved pathogen associated molecular patterns. TLRs are critical bridges between the innate and adaptive immunity, especially the cellular immunity mediated by T cells. Emerging evidence indicated that B cells express almost all subtypes of TLRs. TLRs play critical role not only in regulation of proliferation, maturation and function of B cells, but also in pathogenesis of diseases, such as systemic lupus erythematosus and chronic lymphocytic leukemia. Targeting TLRs of B cells is a promising therapeutic strategy for these disorders.

title: Optical characteristic of ion beam sputter deposited aluminum thin films
abstract: Aluminum is a typical active metal very easy to oxidize. An oxide surface layer of about 2~6nm quickly formed in air which adds difficulty to the optical constants determination. An ex-situ method is used to determine the optical constants of aluminum thin films. First, alumina (Al2O3) thin film is deposited by ion beam sputter deposition. The optical constants and thickness are determined by spectral ellipsoemtry (SE). The thickness is verified by grazing x-ray reflection (GXRR) fitting method; Second, Al thin film with an Al2O3 cap layer on top is deposited. This cap layer is of the same deposition condition with the first step. By fitting the GXRR spectra, the structure information (the thickness of the aluminum and the cap layer, surface roughness and the diffusion between Al-Al2O3) is obtained; Third, based on the acquired structure information, the ellipsometric spectra are fitted. The optical constants of the aluminum layer┬áΓÇª

title: On the stress distribution at the bonding interface between rock and bolt
abstract: Rock bolt is a major reinforcement technique for roadways in coal mines in China. Generally, separation of the bonding interface between the rock mass and the bolt may lead to collapse of the bolted rock mass due to stress concentration. In order to establish the stress concentration mechanism on the bonding interface, the distribution functions for shear stress and longitudinal force on the interface are derived using Mindlin's model, and a failure criterion for the interface is proposed. In addition, influencing factors for the stress distribution mode are identified. Both analytical study and numerical simulations by ANSYS have shown that, as the elastic modulus of rock increases, both shear stress and the longitudinal force-concentrating zone move towards the outer end of bolt and decrease gradually from the free surface to the rock mass body. Also, there is an optimizing cement thickness which results in relatively┬áΓÇª

title: Chemical constituents of garcinia xanthochymus seeds
abstract: Garcinia xanthochymus Hook. f.(Clusiaceae) or gamboge is a medium sized evergreen tree native to India. The fruit is edible, and used in traditional medicine for the treatment of diarrhea and dysentery. Additionally, the fruit is used to make a yellow fabric dye and as a watercolor pigment. Numerous benzophenones, biflavonoids, triterpenes, xanthones, and lipids have been isolated from various parts of the plant. However, few investigations have been performed on the seeds of G. xanthochymus, and previous research in our laboratory on a related genus has shown that the chemical profile of seeds differs markedly from other plant parts. The current study investigated the chemical composition of a methanolic extract of G. xanthochymus seeds. The extract was partitioned sequentially with solvents, and the resulting partitions analyzed by HPLC and LC/MS. Several compounds including the biflavonoids┬áΓÇª

title: Cloning of beta-1, 3-glucanase gene from Trichoderma virid LTR-2 and its expression in Pichia pastoris
abstract: Text We designed a pair of primers according to fungal glucanase genes obtained from GenBank and cloned a novel beta-1, 3-glucanase gene (glu) from Trichoderma virid LTR-2 cDNA by PCR. Then we linked the fragment with pMD18-T vector and sequenced it. The sequence analysis indicated that glu was composed of 2289 nucleotide residues. The fragment contained an Open Reading Frame coding 762 amino acids and was similar to previous reports. Translated amino acids sequence of glu contained two Conservative Districts of beta-1, 3-glucanase which were RVVYIPPGTY and AASQNKVAYF. By nucleotide blasting in NCBI glu showed high homology to three beta-1, 3-glucanase genes from Trichoderma sp., especially with T. harzianum bgn3. 1 and Hypocrea virens bgn13. 1, which the homology reached 93%. The sequence was submitted to GenBank and the Accession Number is EF176582. Then we connected glu gene with the Pichia pastoris shuttle vector-pPIC9K. The recombinant plasmid named pGLU14 was transformed into methylotropic yeast P. pastoris KM71 after linearization. The recombinant strain KGLU14 expressing beta-1, 3-glucanase at high level was obtained through plate screening. The SDS-PAGE result indicated that molecular weight of the recombinant beta-1, 3-glucanase was about 80kDa and the activity of the recombinant enzyme could reach 889U/mL in liquid culture.

title: Numerical Simulation and Experimental Study on Thermal Damage in in vitro Human Skin-tissue by High-intensity Laser
abstract: This paper based on the interaction theory mechanism of laser-biotissue, the 2-D heat transfer model of laser-irradiated invitro human skin-tissue was established. Finite method was used to solve the numerical simulation results for temperature distribution for the PennesΓÇ▓ bioheat transfer equations. Experiments about damage in invitro human skin-tissue irradiated by continuous laser are carried out. It is found that when the irradiation time reaches 6.83 s, the heated evaporization is occurred. When the irradiation time reaches 11.20 s, the heated carbonization is occurred. When the irradiation time reaches 25.30 s, the heated combustion is occurred. The result of theoretical analysis exhibits good agreement with the experimental result.

title: Microstructure of Nano-Zirconia Coatings Elaborated by Plasma Spray Liquid Precursor Sol [J]
abstract: A nanostructured zirconia coatings was elaborated by plasma spray liquid precursor sol. The phase composition and microstructure of the coatings and powders dried from sol was observed by XRD and SEM. The results showed that Non-crystal was obtained by drying sol spontaneously, while crystal structure can be obtained by heating, and the coatings was mixed crystal structure of monocline and cubic by plasma spray. The coatings were composed of dense well melted particles and micro-cracks. The fine grain nanostructured zirconia can be obtained.

title: Preparation of Nano-Zirconia Coating by Plasma Spray Sol and Characterization of Coating Microstructure [J]
abstract: A nanostructured zirconia coating was prepared by plasma spray sol process. The phase composition and microstructure of the coatings and powders dried from the sol were analyzed by means of X-ray diffraction and scanning electron microscopy. Results showed that spontaneously dried sol had amorphous structure, and it was transformed to crystal structure after being heated. The coating preparedby plasma spray had mixed monocline and cubic crystal structure, and it was composed of dense blocks formed by well melted particles and contained micro-cracks as well.

title: A Study on the Production Performance of the Crotalaria Mucronata Desv and its Effect of Feeding Rabbits [J]
abstract: Feasibility of Crotalaria mucronata Desv as feed for rabbit and its development prospect are explored results are as followed: Γæ┤The annual output of Crotalaria mucronata Desv was about 50 420 kg/hm2, and it could be cut 3~ 4 times every year.(2) In the dry material, the crude protein, the crude fat, the coarse fiber, the ash, the calcium and the phosphorus is 21.00%, 2.30%, 20.70%, 7.00%, 10.20%, 1.36%, 0.48% respectively.(3) The absolute weight gain of rabbit did not differ significantly between the test group and the control one (4 300g vs 4 160g, P0. 05). Feed conversion efficiency of the control group and the test one is 38.62%, 40.56% respectively, and the feed conversion efficiency of Crotalaria mucronata Desv is higher than that of the basic feed. The results indicate that adding 30% the Crotalaria mucronata Desv can replace Medicago sativa diets to feed the rabbit, which has greater development and utilization value.

title: Analysis of bacterial distribution and drug resistance in patients with bronchiectasis [J]
abstract: Objective To analyze the bacterial distribution and drug resistance in patients with bronchiectasis. Methods Sputum bacterial cultivation and drug sensitivity tests were performed on 106 bronchiectasis patients from 2004 to 2007. Results There were 48 positive cases among 106 bronchiectasis patients (45.2%) by sputum bacterial cultivation. Forty-nine strains of bacteria were isolated including 33 cases of Pseudomonas aeruginosa (67.4%), 8 cases of Baumanii (16.3%), 4 cases of Klebsiella pneumoniae (8.3%), 1 case of Pseudomonas stanieri (2.0%), 1 case of Acinetinbacter lwoffi (2.0%), 1 case of Escherichia coli.(2.0%) and 1 case of Candida albicans (2.0%). Conclusion Pseudomonas aeruginosa were is isolated most frequently in patients with bronchiectasis. It is suggested that reasonable use of antibiotics to reduce drug resistance is very important.

title: Study on the Determination of Nereistoxins Residues in Food by Gas Chromatography-Tandem Mass Spectrometry
abstract: This paper describes method for the determination of the residues of nereistoxins in food by gas chromatography-tandem mass spectrometry (GC-MS/MS). Samples were extracted from the homogeneous sample with 0.1 mol/L HCl solution, and converted into nereistoxin in alkaline medium with sodium sulfide solution. Then the nereistoxin was extracted by chloroform, and determined by GC-MS/MS. The average recoveries of nereistoxin at the spiked concentration levels of 50-200 ╬╝g┬╖ kg-1 were range of 80%-96%. Good repeatability was obtained in all the cases with RSD of 3.0%-10.4%. The limit of determination was 0.05 mg┬╖ kg-1, and the limit of quantity was 0.1 mg┬╖ kg-1.

title: THE INFLUENCE OF ADDITIVE ON THE EP/AW PROPERTIES OF UREA GREASES
abstract: The urea greases were prepared by using the same type base oils with different viscosity and the same thickener. Then the 3% phosphorus-containing additive was added to the urea greases respectively. The change of EP/AW properties among the base greases and the greases after adding additive was compared. The results showed that the viscosity of base oil has great influence on improving the EP/AW properties of additive in grease. Raising properly the viscosity of base oil can help to increase the EP/AW properties of grease. The phosphorus-containing additive is a kind of effective EP/AW additive. In the urea greases prepared by base oils with different viscosity, the additive has good synergism on the anti-wear property.

title: Study on the Synthesis of Alkyl-pectin [J]
abstract: In order to obtain a new carrier for the colon-specific drug, alkyl-pectin was prepared. The modification of pectin with 1-bromoctane in the presence of an alkali was studied using tetrabutyl ammonium bromide as catalyst. The result showed that the alkyl-pectin abtained was water resistant. The alkyl-pectin structure was characterized by FT IR, EA, DSC and~ 1H NMR analysis.

title: Research progress on the pathogenesis and therapeutics of renal fibrosis [J]
abstract: Renal fibrosis is a common consequence of chronic kidney diseases that leads to chronic renal failure. The pathological characteristics of renal fibrosis is disproportionate accumulation of extracellular matrix that replaces kidney parenchyma, ultimately leading to renal destruction and dysfunction. Several pathways are involved in renal fibrosis, such as inflammation, apoptosis of renal cells, infiltrated immune cells, oxide stress and imbalance of relocated cytokines. Here, we review the pathogenesis of renal fibrosis, and research progress in the novel targets and promising therapeutic strategies.

title: Preparation and Luminescence of ZrO_2 Nanopowders Via Solvothermal Method [J]
abstract: Zirconia nanoparticles were synthesized via solvothermal method, and their compsition, morphology and luminescent property have been investigated. XRD results showed that the phase compositions of the products synthesised at various temperatures have significant difference, product synthesised at 140Γäâ composed of pure tetragonal zirconia, and the volume fraction of monoclinic zirconia were enhanced with increased reaction temperature. Nevertheless, there was little difference among the TEM photographs of ZrO_2 nanoparticles synthesised at different temperatures, nanopowders were all spherical and showed obvious aggregation. The luminescence properties of ZrO_2 nanopowders synthesised at 140Γäâ were investigated and the results show that, under 250 nm excitation, there was a strong and broad emission peak at 402nm and a broad excitation peak relative weak emission peak at 625 nm, respectively.

title: Parametric Design of Horizontal Straight Generatrix Plough Body Surface Based on SolidWorks [J]
abstract: The forming mechanism of horizontal straight generatrix plough body surface is studied, attribute manager dialogue based on the characteristics of SolidWorks is re-developed, combined with the powerful three-dimensional molding system, module for parametric design of horizontal straight generatrix plough body surface is developed, seamless integration of the developed system and SolidWorks is realized, so the problems of complicated design procedure, big error, strong labor intension in design of horizontal straight generatrix plough body surface are effectively solved, the optimization design becomes very direct-viewing and convenient, makes standardization and serialization of further development of plough body products easier, realizes the purpose of shortening design cycle and improving economic benefits.

title: Aqueous tape casting of Li~ 1~.~ 0~ 7~ 5Nb~ 0~.~ 6~ 2~ 5Ti~ 0~.~ 4~ 5O~ 3 using PVA/PVAc co-binder
abstract: Li1+ x-yNb1-x-3yTix+ 4yO3 microwave ceramic tapes were prepared by aqueous tape casting using polyvinyl alcohol (PVA) and polyvinyl acetate (PVAc) as co-binder. The effects of PVAc contents and solid loadings on rheological behavior and mechanical properties were studied. The apparent viscosity and yield stress of the slurries were markedly decreased with increasing PVAc content. As the solid loading was increased, the rheological characteristics of the slurries varied from Bingham model to Casson model. The tensile test indicated that the failure characteristics of the green tapes showed a transition from ductile fracture to brittle fracture with the increase of PVAc content. In addition, the microstructure of the green tapes was homogeneous.

title: The Unit Root and Cointegration Tests for Error Correction Models in Panel DataΓÇöΓÇöBased on the Study on Fiscal Expenditure and Economic Growth in Hubei Province
abstract: This paper has a study on fiscal expenditure and economic growth in Hubei Province. First, it uses the unit root tests to find the growth of fiscal expenditure and the economic growth. Second, it uses cointegration tests to find obvious positive relations in fiscal expenditure and economic growth, and it uses error correction models to correct it and find that it has real obvious positive relations in fiscal expenditure and economic growth.

title: Affecting factors on the quality of prebaked anode for aluminium electrolysis
abstract: With the development of the large-scale aluminium smelting cell all over the world and the better developing trend of aluminium electrolysis market, it is an effective way to increase output and benefits by enhancing current., but it brings us a problem that a kind of anode which has higher quality and can support higher current density is needed. In this paper, the effects of the materials used for prebaked anode such as petroleum coke, coal tar pitch, stub and impurity elements, and all sorts of production technologcial conditions on anode quality are mainly discussed. By this, anode quality can be improved, anode consume can be reduced and usage life of anode can be relonged through decreasing the content of impurity elements, which can demand for the large-scale aluminium smelting cell production.

title: The detection of micrometastases in the peripheral blood of patients with breast cancer for hSBEM mRNA and CD44V6 mRNA
abstract: Objective                 Successful treatment of breast cancer greatly depends on the early detection of its metastasis, therefore a sensitive and specific biomarker for detecting dissemination of the cancer cells will help to achieve this goal. This study was to evaluate the prognostic significance of human small breast epithelial mucin (hSBEM) and CD44V6 in breast cancer.                                               Methods                 The expressions of hSBEM mRNA and CD44V6 mRNA were detected with nested reverse transcription polymerase chain reaction (nested RT-PCR) in 67 samples of breast cancer and adjacent normal breast tissue, 16 samples of breast benign lesions tissue, and 67 specimens of peripheral blood from patients with breast cancer, 16 specimens of benign breast lesions, 20 specimens of healthy volunteers, and 25 (each five cases) other carcinomas tissue samples, including those of gastric┬áΓÇª

title: Analysis on mental health level of adolescent offenders in supervisation station in Hefei city [J]
abstract: Aim To explore the mental health level of adolescent offenders in supervisation station and to offer consultation basis for prevention. Method SCL-90 questionnaires were conducted among 408 adolescent offenders in supervisation station by cluster sampling in June 2008. Results The results showed that means of ten symptomatic factors was 3.2%, 6.9%, 7.4%, 4.9%, 4.9%, 9.8%, 2.2%, 7.1%, 5.9%, and 8.3% respectively. Total positive rate of SCL-90 was 21.3%(male 21.1% and female 26.7% respectively). But there were no significant differences in total positive rate and each factor of positive rate between the sex and age group. Conclusions At present, there were serious mental health problems in adolescent offenders in supervisation station. Propaganda and prevention will be very important in future.

title: Discovery of Active Component of Alkaloid From Marine Microorgamism Using Molecularly Imprinted Technique [J]
abstract: The molecularly imprinted polymer (MIP) was synthesized by taking harmine as the template molecule and methylacrylic acid as the functional monomer, and the MIP was then used as solid phase extraction material to extract harmine and its structural analogs from the secondary metabolites produced by a sponge associated marine bacterium Pseudoalteronomas sp. NJ6-3-1. It is shown from the experimental results that the molecularly imprinted technique is an effective method to selectively separate and extract the active component from marine microorgamism.

title: The Applied Values of Tujia Cotton Ball Sport [J]
abstract: The cotton ball sport is, to some degree, entertaining, which exerts positive influences on people's mental health. It also palys an extremely important role in promoting human wisdom, develoing personal mentality and cultivating the ability of observation.

title: Applied experiment of petro coke residue slurry in rotary kiln
abstract: An applied experiment of petro coke residue slurry was carried in a rotary kiln, we carry on systematic examination to the calcined alumina quality and waste gas of kiln tail etc. The experimental result indicated that petro coke residue slurry could be pumped in atomization and combustion as heavy oil, not influence the calcined alumina product quality, the rotary kiln circulated stably in experimental period, the application of petro coke residue slurry is viable on the large kiln or stove.

title: Process of multi-enzyme assisted extraction of Danshensu from Salvia mitiorrhiza [J]
abstract: Objective To study the effect of enzyme in the extraction of Salvia mitiorrhiza and the influence of different factors on enzymatic extraction. Methods Monofactorial experiments were employed to examine the effects of the substrate size, enzyme consumption, ratio of solid to liquid, 1st enzymatic extraction time, and 2nd water extraction time on the extraction of S. mitiorrhiza. Ultraviolet-visible spectrophotometry was used to analyze the results and Danshensu extraction rate was regarded as standard. Results The data showed that the highest Danshensu extraction rate (84.61%) could be achieved at: t= 50Γäâ, pH= 4.6, granularity= 20-35 meshes, ES= 1Γê╢ 200, 1st enzymatic extraction time= 80 min, SL= 1Γê╢ 15, 2nd water extraction time= 40 min, SL= 1Γê╢ 9. Conclusion This process could be conducted under mild conditions and in relatively simple equipment, which could help reduce energy cost, alleviate gelatinization, and lower the possibility of product oxidation, and thus it is considerably feasible.

title: Blurred Classification Study on the Effect of Trace Elements in Several Plant Extracts on the Formation of AGEs in vitro.
abstract: The interrelation between trace elements, organic compounds and the effect on AGEs in several plant extracts were studied through method of blurred classification. Firstly, AGEs with glyoxal, fructose or glucose was prepared, then the plant extracts were added to test the effect. Secondly, Inductively Coupled Plasma-Atomic Emission Spectrometry was used to determine the contents of seven trace dements, Zn, Mg, Mn, Mo, Cu, Cr, V. By range analysis, correlation coefficients and relative fuzzy matrix were calculated to combine with Zn/Cu and Zn/Mn. It was found that most of the components can inhibit the formation of AGEs, especially, the effect of FFH was close to FRR, cluster in the two plant extracts was similar when relative coefficient was 0.75. The finding of this study suggested that trace dements and organic compounds of STT have much to do with the formation of AGEs.

title: Determination of optical constants of zirconia and silica thin films in UV to visible range
abstract: A curve fitting method for determining the optical constants of some dielectric thin films is described with dispersion theory in the paper. A computer program based on Matlab is developed and optimized. The fitting errors are analyzed with theoretical data, which gives very high accurate results. A program is applied to fitting the measured photometric spectra of ion sputtered zirconia and silica thin films in 200-850nm spectra range. The thickness is verified with the method of grazing x-ray diffraction. With the thickness known, the optical constants of zirconia films near the absorption range are obtained with single-wavelength method. As a result, quite good fitting results are obtained with high accuracy. Finally, an ultraviolet (UV) high-pass optical filter is designed with optical constants extracted by this method. The transmission and reflection spectra of the filter are measured and compared to designed spectra. A┬áΓÇª

title: Production of l-ephedrine and d-pseudoephedrine in recombined yeasts obtained by argon ion implantation mediated Ephedra genome DNA transformation
abstract: The genome DNA from Ephedra glauca was randomly transferred into Hansenula anomala, respectively, by argon ion bombardment. Then, after screening by the motheds of bromothymol blue indicator selection, slant cultivation, l-ephedrine and d-pseudoephedrine copper chromic salt qualitative test and RP-HPLC determination, 3 strains, producing recombined yeasts were obtained, which can use glucose as a carbon source, NaNO3 as nitrogen source and be genetically stable. After cultivated in liquid medium for 72 hours and analyzed by the RP-HPLC, the recombined strains can produce l-ephedrine 11.87 mg/L and d-pseudoephedrine 4.11 mg/L excellular, d-pseudoephedrine 294.86 mg/g dry cell incellular, but l-ephedrine not detected incellular. The transformation efficiency of Ephedra genome DNA transferred into yeasts via argon ion bombardment was 0.65%. The effects of Ephedra genome DNA macromolecule integrity on yeast transformation system were discussed. The results shown that DNA macromolecule with integrated structure used as exogenous donor can obtain higher transformation efficiency than DNA macromolecule random fragments by ion implantation mediated DNA transformation. It was inferred that biosynthesis of l-ephedrine and the d-pseudoephedrin were controlled by linked together genes or gene clusters.

title: Electrically evoked stapedius reflex threshold and its clinical contribution of cochlear implantations
abstract: OBJECTIVE: To investigate and measure the electrically evoked stapedius reflex threshold (ESRT) and the maximum comfortable level (MCL), the feasibility of using objective index of the fitting of speech processor was evaluated. METHODS: The relationship of ESRT and MCL was conducted by measuring the ESRT and MCL of 28 Medel Combi 40+ cochlear implant users from August 2003 to April 2006. RESULTS: The incidence of ESRT of 10 patient during operation was 78.3%(94/120), and the incidence 3 months after the operation was 82.5%(99/120). The incidence of ESRT in 3 patients with Large vestibular aqueduct syndrome was 47.2%(17/36). The ESRT and MCL of each electrode of those 28 patients after operation were compared, the result was shown as following:(1) 247 electrodes' MCL were greater than ESRT;(2) 14 electrodes' MCL were equal to ESRT;(3) 46 electrodes' MCL were smaller than ESRT. The average of ESRT after operation was (677.1+/-109.8) cu, the average of MCL was (732.3+/-114.8) cu. ESRT was smaller than MCL (t= 11.37, P< 0.05). CONCLUSIONS: The cochlear implantations must be in normal working condition when ESR was positive. ESRT is a useful method to map the fitting of speech processor.

title: Research on ion implantation effect on SIMOX material modification technique by X-ray photoelectron spectroscopy
abstract: Separation-by-implanted-oxygen (SIMOX) material was modified by silicon ions implantation with different techniques in this work, and the chemical bonds of Si in the buried oxide layer (BOX) of the SIMOX wafers were investigated with X-ray photoelectron spectroscopy (XPS) method. The results of Si 2p were presented to demonstrate the modification mechanism of the SIMOX materials, which could be resulted from the formation of different Si chemical structures in the silicon oxidation by the ions implantation with the post anneal process. The results of IDΓÇôVG characteristics on the wafers with Pseudo-MOS method showed that the processes of the buried oxide affected the character of the IDΓÇôVG curves of the Pseudo-MOS.

title: Energy analysis of two different air-conditioning systems of a building
abstract: Used the BIN energy analysis method to make the energy consumption analysis of two different air-conditioning systems in the building of Tianjin, and compared the differences between two systems on energy consumption, giving some suggestion on energy saving.

title: Study on the Properties of Xylanase
abstract: Properties of xylanases were studied by the method of DNS. The results showed that the optimal temperature and optimal pH of the xylanase was 50Γäâ and 6, respectively. Xylanase activity was stable between pH5 and pH10, and the themal stability of the enzyme was good in lipid below 60Γäâ. The Km values and Vmax of xylanase for xylan from oat spelts under 50Γäâ, pH6 were 6.49 mg/mL and 21.05 ╬╝g/(mL┬╖ min), respectively. The xylanase had the highest activity when xylan from oat spelts was used as the substrate. The enzyme activity was inhibited in stomach and restored in small intestine.

title: Treatment of Pipkin's Fracture with Herbert Screws [J]
abstract: Objective To evaluate the clinical results of Herbert screws in the treatment of posterior dislocations of hip with femoral heads fracture (PipkinΓÇ▓ s fractures). Methods From 1994 to 2006, 11 patients with PipkinΓÇ▓ s fractures were treated with Herbert screws through GibsonΓÇ▓ s approach, 3 were type Γàá, 4 type Γàí, 1 type Γàó, 3 type Γàú according to PipkinΓÇ▓ s classification. Results Eleven patienst were followed-up for 1/2~ 12 years. The results were excellent in 3 cases, good in 5 cases, fair in 2 cases, poor in 1 case by EpsteinΓÇ▓ score. Rate of excellent and good result was 72.7%. Conclusion The Herbert scerew provides rigid internal fixation and its damage to articular cartilage is light. ItΓÇ▓ s an ideal material in treating PipkinΓÇ▓ s fractures.

title: State Feedback Robust Passive Control for Interval Generalized Systems
abstract: The problem of state feedback robust passive control for a class of interval generalized systems is discussed. Firstly, a kind of equivalent description of the interval generalized systems is given. Then a sufficient condition for solvability of the problem and the controller are obtained in terms of matrix inequalities of the system's parameters. The designed controller is guaranteed that the closed-loop systems is both generally quadratically stable and passive. Finally, a numerical example is given to demonstrate the feasibility of the conclusion.

title: Simulated Research on Energy-saving Mode of Enlarged Industrial Heating System
abstract: In this article, study energy-saving operation for enlarged industrial heating system based on its construction characteristic and different heat load at night and at daytime; program the hydraulic operation conditions simulator with MATLAB; study the heating available using the existed pipeline, and at the same time, put forward the effectiveenergy-saving measure. Research into the idiographic industrial heating system and give energy-saving scheme suitable for it.

title: Nonlinear model of micro-machined capacitive accelerometer operating in open-loop mode
abstract: To enhance the measurement range of capacitive micro-machined accelerometer and to cope with the complex nonlinear error of open-loop accelerometers, based on the mechanics theory and the interface circuit principle, the nonlinear model of micro-machined accelerometer operating in open loop mode is proposed. With the output increase, the measurand acceleration increases roughly linear with the output voltage until it approaches the maximum acceleration ╬▒max, then, it decrease till the point where electrodes are pulled in. The ╬▒max is decided by d and ╬╗, which is the ratio between the spring constant and the mass of the microstructure, and d is better than ╬╗ as far as the contribution to the ╬▒ max is concerned. The accelerometer canΓÇÖt work when d is less than a critical point which is determined by transducerΓÇÖs parameter ╬╖ and the optimum of ╬╖ is from 1├ù 1019 to 2├ù 1019, where the pull in point is beyond 95% of the full travel range of the moveable electrode. The model can be applied to the nonlinear errorΓÇÖs correction of open loop capacitive accelerometer and is valuable for the accelerometerΓÇÖs design.

title: Digital Filtering in the PLC System
abstract: In this paper, digital filtering methods used in Siemens S7-200 series PLC control system are introduced. Elimination of the influence of interference to improve the reliability of PLC control system in software design is also discussed.

title: Peer-to-peer File-sharing Ideas
abstract: P2P network applications today is a big favorite. This paper introduces the P2P technology, the paper how one pair of such transfer to another side of the other side. Right after the adoption of peer-to-peer development has several models of the analysis set out a reciprocal side is how to find it in the paper achieve positioning mechanism. Intent allowing readers to peer-to-peer technology is an overall grasp. Finally, the P2P future direction of development to be studied and solved the problems of individuals made certain prospect.

title: Design of two mirror beam-shaping and fiber coupling for diode bars
abstract: Optical shaping transform system was described by using fiber-coupled theory, the collimated beam was superposed by using two mirror reflect method, and the condition and structure expression of beam-shaper was given. Referring to increasing shaping-times caused by slow-axis divergence and losing power caused by multi-reflection, a beam-shaper of 13 times shaping was designed after analysis and optimization of shaper's structure. The balance of beam parameter products of diode's two directions was achieved. Simulation and experiment of optical system show that laser diode bar is coupled into a 200╬╝m fiber with NA= 0.22 and efficiency approximate 50%.

title: Image Segmentation Based on Data Field
abstract: In this paper, we analyze the theory and methods of dada field, put forward a method of image segmentation based on data field, realize the visualization during the process of the segmentation, analyze the result of some experiments qualitatively and quantitatively, show the feasibility and availability.

title: Optimization Method of Haptic Rendering Based on Collision Detection
abstract: An optimization method based on collision detection was proposed. According to the movement states of haptic device, a bounding box was constructed dynamically in the main process, then an improved oriented bounding box (OBB) collision detection method was used to prune a large number of untouchable triangle collections, and the remnants were rendered separately in haptic process. The results of practical instances depict that the runtime of the improved method is stable with little influence by the number of triangle in scene, which verifies that this optimization method for rendering is suitable for haptic rendering of virtual assembly scene.

title: Feature segmentation of sectional curve based on multi-scale analysis in reverse engineering
abstract: To obtain segmentation of primary curve primitives and secondary curve primitives for feature-based reconfiguration of sectional curves, a feature segmentation method was presented based on theory of multi-scale and characteristics identification for reverse engineering. Curvature scale space was used to conduct multi-scale analysis and feature detection in the proposed method. Relative angle was used to realize single-scale feature fusion. Based on information transmission and fusion among multi-scale, multi-scale feature fusion algorithm was proposed to merge the multi-scale features. Comparing to conventional single-scale analysis of sectional curve in reverse engineering, multi-scale curvature analysis guaranteed the consistency between feature segmentation results and primitives for feature-based design and modeling. Synthetic curves and practical scanned sectional curves indicated that the proposed method was effective in multi-scale feature segmentation.

title: Effect of Apolipoprotein E Gene Polymorphism on Serum Concentration of Lipids and Lipid-Adjusting Effect of Correspond Medicine in Hyperlipidemia Patients with Phlegm and Blood┬áΓÇª
abstract: Objective To explore the effects of apolipoprotein E gene polymorphism on serum concentration of lipids and lipid-adjusting effect of correspond medicine in hyperlipidemia patients with phlegm and blood stasis syndrome in the Han nationality in north china. Methods Totally 172 cases of hyperlipidemia patients with phlegm and blood stasis syndrome were randomly divided into observation group (n= 87) and control group (n= 85). The observation group was treated by Tiaozhi Tongmai Granule. The control group was treated by Xuezhikang Capsule. Clinical symptom and serum concentration of lipid were observed before and after treatment. Using PCR-RFLP methods, we analyzed the forth extron genotypes of ApoE gene in 172 cases. Results In hyperlipidemia patients with phlegm and blood stasis syndrome, serum concentration of lipid in observation group and control group were greatly improved after treatment. The total effective rate of observation group was superior to that of control group (P0. 01). Before treatment, serum LDL-C concentration of ApoE E3/3 and E3/4 genetype was significantly higher than that of the E2/3 (P0. 05~ 0.01). The serum LDL-C concentration of E3/4 genetype was more significantly improved than that of the E2/3 and E3/3 genetype (P0. 01). Conclusion Sensitivity of lipid-adjusting effect of correspond medicine differed due to different ApoE genotype in hyperlipidemia patients with phlegm and blood stasis syndrome, indicated that heredity factor plays an important role.

title: Region Growing Segmentation Algorithm Based on Multi-scale Geometric Analysis [J]
abstract: Aimed at the selection of seed region and seed growing algorithm of region growing for feature segmentation in reverse engineering, an automatic feature segmentation method was developed based on theory of multi-scale and region growing. Curvature scale space was used for the multi scale geometric analysis and feature detection in the proposed method. Based on information correlations among multi-scale feature detection, a new seed growing algorithm was proposed according to multi-scale feature detection. As the homogeneity criteria, relative angle was used to obtain feature segmentation. Feature fusion was presented to obtain an optimization result of feature segmentation. Instead of conventional single scale analysis, multi-scale geometric analysis guarantees the robust selection of seed region and the reliable seed growing algorithm. Practical scanned surface point data indicates that the presented method works effectively on feature segmentation.

title: Study on the Selective Hydrogenation of Cinnamaldehyde over the Co-B/SBA-15 Amorphous Catalyst
abstract: A supported Co-B amorphous alloy catalyst with mesoporous structure was prepared by impregnating the SBA-15 support with aqueous CoCl2 solution, followed by reduction with KBH4 solution. Unlike the Co-B/SiO2 in which most Co-B alloy particles were dispersed on the outer surface, the Co-B particles in the Co-B/SBA-15 catalyst were mainly distributed homogeneously in the channels of the SBA-15 support. During liquid phase cinnamaldehyde (CMA) hydrogenation, the as-prepared Co-B/SBA-15 exhibited much higher activity and yield toward cinnamyl alcohol (CMO) than the conventional Co-B/SiO2, possibly owing to the high and homogeneous distribution of Co active sites on the support, and the regular and well-ordered large size pore channels which favored the diffusion and adsorption of CMA molecules. Perhaps, the difference in nature of the active centers of these two catalysts, such as the cluster structure and the electronic state of the active sites should also be considered in order to explain their different catalytic behaviors.

title: Measuring the Possibility of Logistics Outsourcing Based on Fuzzy Analysis
abstract: By analyzing the urgency of the domestic enterprise logistics outsourcing, eight comprehensive indicators are selected according to affection model about logistics outsourcing and fuzzy comprehensive analysis is applied to mathematize the decision-makingΓÇ▓ s thinking process, thereby supporting the final decision on logistics outsourcing, and useing ultimately an example to test the method.

title: Effects of friction on precision forging process of blade with a damper platform
abstract: A blade with a damper platform, with excellent anti-vibration characteristic and high efficiency, has become one of the most important types of blades being developed in the aeronautical engines. During the precision forging process of this blade, the friction between dies and workpiece has important effects on metal flow, deformation defects, load and energy etc. So researching the effects of friction conditions on the forging process of blade with a damper platform has been a crucial problem urgent to be resolved. In this paper, the precision forging process of titanium alloy blade with a damper platform under different friction conditions has been simulated and analyzed based on the DEFORM-3D software platform. The obtained results reveal the influence laws of friction on temperature field and load-stroke curves, and provide a significant basis for determining technological parameters of the blade forging process.

title: Function of EnterpriseΓÇ▓ s Library in the Information Construction and Development [J]
abstract: On the one hand, the exploiting of information resources is very important to raise the enterpriseΓÇ▓ s competitiveness; on the other hand, the enterpriseΓÇ▓ s library has its own advantages on providing information services for the enterpriseΓÇ▓ s information construction and development.

title: Studies on PCR dete mination cherry of prunus necrotic ring-spot virus
abstract: Through comparing two extracting methods of complete RNA, the results of electrophoresis that method A produced the typical RNA belt and the integrality of RNA is better than method B. Using the complete RNA as template and selected primers to RT-PCR reaction, the amplified DNA belt is the same with the DNA fragment amplified by expectant primers. It indicated that the PCR reacting system is specialized. The two of 30 examined samples produced clear and distinct belt and occupied 6.7% in total samples.

title: Research on Real-time Modeling Method of Forest Weather
abstract: This paper proposes a novel half-transparent volume modeling arithmetic: learn inputed image sequence in order to create processing texture, the color regions of image can be obtained by synthesizing textureΓÇÖs boundary, and draws the outline of image by scanning boundary of region and computes color value for every boundary of gridding according to current color, creates 3D model according to color value of gridding. Experiment shows that this modeling arithmetic of motion scenery can satisfy demand of painting timely and is robust and consecutive.

title: Estimating Retention Properties of Components of a Block Scale Fracture Network an Example from the ├äsp├╢ Hard Rock Laboratory, Sweden.
abstract: Crystalline rock is typically viewed as consisting of essentially impervious rock blocks separated by fractures. These fractures include both high-conductivity structures along which most of the flow takes place, and lower-conductivity fractures which are either hydraulically inactive, or carry very low flow. A number of tracer tests (" Tracer Retention Understanding Experiments"-TRUE) have been carried out along high-conductivity fractures (T> 10-7 m2/s) since 1995 at the ├äsp├╢ Hard Rock Laboratory (Sweden), with the purpose of characterizing their retention properties. However, from the safety assessment point of view, lower conductivity fractures (often referred to as" background fractures") could play an important role for the overall retention of radionuclides, since such fractures are most likely to be exposed to the initial release from a leaky radioactive waste canister. The most recent series of tracer tests performed┬áΓÇª

title: Comparison of two sentinel lymph node biopsy processing protocols in clinically N0 head and neck squamous cell carcinoma (HNSCC).
